name: Condo in Jersey City · ★5.0 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 shared bath
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is very diverse & friendly shopping/restaurants on Central Avenue absolutely adorable very safe to walk to. The Neighborhood has a beautiful park walking distance ❤️ read a book ride your bike , rollerblade or just simply relax along the resting area ❤️ the park also has a pool / skating rink/ ice hockey very nice, this park is called Pershing Fields NJ
host_about: I am the owner of a high end Nail Salon in the area and I work long days.  I was born and raised in the Mid-West so I have old fashion traditions and values. I consider myself to be a socialite; friendly and easy going. My home is my sanctuary, always clean and extremely peaceful. I love to work out at the gym, pamper my dog and spend time with my child Logan ! The Milk room is infant ready , we supply a baby crib up to age three /60lbs.

name: Rental unit in Jersey City · ★4.37 · 2 bedrooms · 3 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Our House is located in the Liberty State Park neighborhood and you are invited to enjoy the private large two bedrooms apartment on second floor .The kitchen is completely new and is fully supplied with dishes and cookware, and has a gas range, stainless steel refrigerator, granite counter top, microwave and dishwasher. Fresh bedding linens and towels are included.

There is also free street parking for those with a car.

Location is great. Just 25 - 40 minutes by convenient public transportation to Manhattan and just 10 minutes by car. Walking distance to Liberty State Park with beautiful views of Manhattan, there is recreation area, jogging paths, playground, barbecue areas, Science Museum and the ferry to Ellis Island and the Statue of Liberty.

There is 10- 15 minutes walk from historic downtown Jersey City with trendy restaurants, bars, and shops. From there you can take the PATH subway to Manhattan (2 stops to the World Trade Center or 4-5 stops

name: Townhouse in Jersey City · ★4.77 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 private bath
neighborhood_overview:
Downtown Jersey City is right outside of Manhattan, and has great restaurants, bars, and shops all within walking distance. There are parks nearby as well. If you walk 10 minutes to the waterfront you will get spectacular views of Manhattan. A large shopping mall and grocery store are also a couple blocks away. I have lived here over 15 years and feel very safe.

Other local attractions include Hoboken and Liberty State Park which has ferry service to the Statue of Liberty, Ellis Island, and Manhattan.
host_about: I live in Jersey City and am a WFH graphic artist. I love travel, the beach, and helping people have a great stay in the NYC area.
neighbourhood: Jersey City, New Jersey, United States

name: Rental unit in Jersey City · ★5.0 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
The neighborhood is seconds from "Little India", which offers low-budget to formal Indian dining, in addition to Filipino, Latin American, and Egyptian cuisine, reflecting the city's wide ethnic population. Downtown Jersey City is also minutes away and offers a big variety of Bars and Restaurants.

Jersey City is just across the Hudson river, and it's closer and better connected to the heart of Manhattan than some boroughs and locations in New York City. It is literally 10 minutes away from Downtown Manhattan by subway (path train) and 15mn away from Greenwich Village and midtown. The Path Train runs all day and all night on a schedule.
host_about:
I am an artist working with movement and stuff. Originally from Italy. 
I travel often with art projects and use airbnb and I equally allow other people to use my house. My place is simple nothing luxurious but with good energy if you are into that, and I try to keep the price affordable.
neighbourhood: Jersey City, New Jersey, United States

name: Guest suite in Jersey City · ★4.94 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: Our area of Jersey City Heights is quiet and safe and yet just a short bus or train ride to the middle of Manhattan. Guests tell us they enjoy coming back to the quiet of our apartment after a busy day in NYC.
host_about: My husband Harry and I work(ed) in the creative arts.  I recently retired. We have lived in this area all of our lives except for two years in London. We have traveled abroad and look forward to meeting people from across the globe.  We are happy to share our insights about where to go in the NYC area.  We have two children who are no longer living at home so we decided to convert our top floor into this lovely vacation rental.  It is a completely separate apartment from our own.  We look forward to having visitors stay in this apartment. We speak some Spanish.
neighbourhood: Jersey City, New Jersey, United States

name: Rental unit in Jersey City · ★4.74 · 1 bedroom · 3 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
The neighborhood is safe and trendy. It’s a great neighborhood for New York City commuters and travelers as well as for those that want to enjoy a bit more calmness than Manhattan while being minutes away from it.

Aside from the proximity to the underground transportation with Manhattan and other parts of New Jersey, you will have in less than 5 minutes walk a large diversity of exciting cafes, restaurants, bars, shops, yoga studios, gyms and a great supermarket (Keyfood).

In less than 15 minutes walk you will reach a large shopping mall, a multiplex movie theater, several parks, and the riverside with some of the best views in the New York Metropolitan Area. If you want more shopping, next to the Newport Mall, you can find Shoprite, BJ’S Wholesale, Bed Bath & Beyond, The Home Depot and Target.
host_about: Spanish architect with offices in New York, Miami, Madrid, and Chennai. Passionate about traveling and understanding other ways of living and thinking. I had the fortune to live and work on five continents. I use Airbnb to both host and travel as a guest.
neighbourhood: Jersey City, New Jersey, United States

name: Rental unit in Jersey City · ★4.75 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Mercer Street is in the heart of Historic Downtown/Van Vorst areas of Jersey City anchored by the Grove Street PATH station. When not exploring Manhattan, there is much to do in Jersey City. These include:
* walking along the Hudson River Waterfront for great views of Manhattan or venturing over to Hoboken for the great bar scene
* checking out the great restaurants in the area
* visiting massive Liberty State Park which has ferry service to Ellis Island and the Statue of Liberty
* taking the kids to the Liberty Science Center
* attending the Farmers' Market or the live music performances at Grove Square: http://www.jcdowntown.org/
* shopping at the Newport Center Mall or the local boutiques scattered on Grove Street or finding a bargain at the flea market on Saturday's at Van Vorst Park
host_about: We love to travel and meet new people. Bob is originally from Connecticut and Francois from France, we've been living in NY/NJ for twenty years. We also like art, music and movies. And we both speak French and English! Due to our busy schedule, one of us will be your host in the listing of your choosing. Welcome to Jersey City and New York!

name: Rental unit in Jersey City · ★4.89 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 shared bath
Serviced apartment in Jersey City · ★4.60 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Why stay in Manhattan when you can savor the peace and quiet of this luxurious Jersey City high-rise? Away from the hustle and bustle of Times Square and Fifth Avenue, this Downtown Jersey City building is a better value than anything you’d find across the Hudson - and you can still get to NYC in minutes via the ferry or the PATH train.

Rest and relax in this peaceful oasis perched on the edge of the river, which features plush mattresses, sophisticated wood furnishings, and spacious closets so you can unpack and stay for a while. In the bathroom, you’ll find masterful tile work and modern fixtures - plus towels and toiletries provided for your convenience.

After a day at the Metropolitan Museum of Art, a matinee show on Broadway, or a packed agenda of meetings, you’re bound to be hungry, Cook up a storm in the full kitchen, which features stainless steel appliances, including a full-size fridge and freezer, an electric stove, an oven, a microwave, and a dishwashe
host_about:
We have been providing vacation rental apartments for over 10 years across the East Coast. We are known for our distinctively furnished apartments in popular locations, and for our attentive service. You’ll find that our rates are quite reasonable. If you're looking for a safe, comfortable place with fabulous amenities and Wi-Fi (we know you need the Wi-Fi!) in the Boston MA area, Washington DC, Miami FL or very close to NYC in Jersey City or Hoboken, we'd love to host you. Many of the buildings where our apartments are located feature amenities such as beautiful lobbies, 24 hour front desk staff, fitness centers, business centers, recreation rooms, indoor or outdoor pools and whirlpools. If you are traveling with children, some buildings offer playgrounds (many buildings are near public playgrounds as well) or indoor playrooms. Depending on the location, you can stay for just a few days, a week, a month or more. 

We offer an assortment of short-term apartments in sizes ranging from a studio to three bedrooms that are fully furnished with all the comforts of home. Our local staff meticulously prepares your apartment before your arrival, and we offer 24 hour assistance for any emergencies after business hours. When you arrive at your apartment, the beds will be made, towels and bath amenities will be stocked in the bathrooms, and the coffee maker will be set up in the kitchen with some sample coffees, sweetener and creamer (teabags too if that is your preference) to start your morning off properly. If you’d like to cook a meal, the kitchen is stocked with dishes, cutlery, glassware and pots and pans. The living room is set up with a TV and cable channels, and the Wi-Fi router password and instructions will be prominently displayed so you can get connected quickly. You can also make local and toll-free phone calls at no charge. 

Please contact us to confirm the exact availability of the apartment you are interested in. We’d love to host you (and your family) for your vacation or business trip.
neighbourhood: Jersey City, New Jersey, United States

name: Rental unit in Jersey City · ★4.77 · Studio · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Jersey City is exploding with new restaurants, high rises, and notoriety ... it is the new hot spot to live in the NYC metro area. You will find one of the best restaurants (Madame Claude's) one block from my place, but there are lots of great bars and restaurants nearby.

RESTAURANTS/BARS:
Madame Claude's - amazing French food, killer brunch, fantastic Parisian music Thursday nights ... get a reservation. (1 min. walk)
Cellar 335 - very cool spot, global eats, tiki themed (1 min)
White Star - local dive bar w/solid food (3 min.)
Porta - great pizza (10 min.)
Taqueria - best Mexican food around, great fish/pork tacos (13 min.)
Talde - pricey, but memorable (10 min.)
Mathews - upscale, menu for everyone (12 min.)
Ibby's Falafel - great falafel sandwich (14 min.)
Pet Shop - used to be local pet shop, now it's a bar (8 min.)
Dullboy - cocktail lounge hip w/NYC vibe (12 min.)
BeClaws - if you want seafood (7 min
host_about:
I am an innovation scout for the construction industry.  I love what I do ... and travel quite a bit.  I live part of the year in Jersey City, part of the year in AZ, and part of the year in NC. 

Cheerio
neighbourhood: Jersey City, New Jersey, United States

name: Rental unit in Jersey City · ★5.0 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview:
Jersey City Heights is enchanting newcomers for its charm, strong sense of community and thriving local business scene.

The Heights overlooks Hoboken from the Palisades, and because Hoboken is a historic district with height restrictions there are no high rises affording the Heights protected NYC views. Central Avenue and Palisade Avenue boast immaculate Manhattan skyline and Hudson River vistas.

Jersey City Heights retains the feeling of a small town and is very walkable. I would describe the Heights as youthful, energetic and extremely diverse.
host_about:
Texas born and raised. Living in Jersey City since 2012. Salon owner and lover of all things pink, musicals, vintage and cute dogs. I enjoy discovering local antique stores and small businesses. 
"A day without laughter is a day wasted" Charlie Chaplin
neighbourhood: Jersey City, New Jersey, United States

name: Home in Jersey City · ★4.91 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1.5 baths
neighborhood_overview:
It is one mile from the Journal Square transportation center (JSQ on the PATH line). From JSQ, you can take the PATH to Newark and catch the NJ Transit trains. You can also go to Hoboken, World Trade Center or take the 33rd Street line to Greenwich Village or uptown. It takes less than one hour to get to 33rd St via PATH. There is a bus stop right on the corner about 100 feet away. From there, you can get the bus to JSQ or directly into Port Authority in NYC, which puts you right near Times Square and the theater district. The bus to Port Authority usually takes 45-60 minutes. We are one block from Lincoln Park, which offers great walks and opportunities to work out, including jogging paths and a track.
We are 5 blocks from St. Peter's University, 1.5 miles to NJCU and a mile from Hudson County Community College.
We are also very close to Liberty State Park, which is one of the most visited state parks in the country! You can get a ferry to the Statue of Liberty or Ellis Is
host_about: I am a lifelong resident of Jersey City, NJ. I work in Hoboken, NJ. I also have spent much of my life at the Jersey Shore. I travel a fair amount and spend a lot of time in New England, specifically Maine and Martha's Vineyard. I am a hairdresser and musician. Piano is my main instrument. I am also a licensed social worker in NJ!  If you are coming to the NJ/NY area, I hope you consider staying here at the beautiful apartment in the Dr. Norton House! I can help you find all sorts of great things to do and places to eat and visit. Contact me for any further questions or info!

name: Rental unit in Jersey City · ★4.84 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: We are just blocks away from Liberty State Park where you can get a great view of the Statue of Liberty and the Manhattan skyline. Our neighborhood (Lafayette) was home to Lenape and then one of the oldest Dutch settlements in the area. We are now an urban area close to light rail and ferry. The PATH train is a 20 minute walk or take the light rail to connect.
host_about: We are a family who loves living in Jersey City. We are involved in community groups working to make this a wonderful place to live, work and play.  We live on a quiet, family-friendly street and enjoy using Liberty State Park and all of the other amenities our area offers. We also love to travel, and our favorite places to visit so far are the west coast of Ireland, Prague, San Francisco and the Yucatan peninsula. We like to be active when traveling- to learn the history of a place. When hosting we love for our guests to learn the same. We will give you as much or as little advice/direction as you want and most of all we want you to enjoy this place as much as we do.
neighbourhood: Jersey City, New Jersey, United States

name: Townhouse in Jersey City · ★4.70 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 private bath
host_about: Hey !  Welcome to your new home! I will be your host. My name is Tarik. My friends call me T.

name: Rental unit in Jersey City · ★4.90 · Studio · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: The Paulus Hook Historic District of Jersey City is in very close proximity to downtown and midtown New York City (Manhattan).  You can take the ferry or path trains to various locations.
host_about:
I spent 20 years on Wall Street as a Risk Manager.  I live here with my family (wife and 7 year old son and 8 year old daughter).  This row house was built in 1843.  I am a CPA and I have an MBA in finance.  I attended NYU and Fordham University.  My family and I live in the top three floors and are making available the garden level.  The garden level is a separate apartment and this building is a legal two family.  The garden level was recently restored and most everything in it is new except for a few items.  The yard is quiet and the apartment has a private entrance from both the street and yard.  

My wife and I typically travel to the Caribbean islands and prefer quiet locations such as Anguilla, St John's, Tortola, Barbuda, the Grenadine Islands or the Outer Islands of the Bahamas.  Because of our children we have not traveled to Europe or other far places in recent years.  We also travel to Maine, Vermont and Cape Code during the summer months.

name: Loft in Jersey City · ★4.44 · 2 bedrooms · 4 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: You are in the center of it all.  The convenience of everything is right outside your door including cafes, restaurants, banks, the post office, businesses, waterfront ferries and trains to New York City.
host_about:
My husband and I are a young professional couple with two young children who love to travel. We know what we like for our family when we travel, so we make sure to keep items around our homes so people will feel like they are home.

Having been educated at the prestigious hotel and restaurant school at Cornell University, we learned from the best how to treat guests.  We enjoy taking care of the small details and touches that show how much we care -- a shiny bathroom sink, tucked and smooth bedding or a basket of goodies --we look for those same details when we travel.

Our motto is to do everything with excellence as if God is watching -- because He is! :-)

name: Serviced apartment in Jersey City · ★4.83 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Why stay in Manhattan when you can savor the peace and quiet of this luxurious Jersey City high-rise? Away from the hustle and bustle of Times Square and Fifth Avenue, this Downtown Jersey City building is a better value than anything you’d find across the Hudson - and you can still get to NYC in minutes via the ferry or the PATH train.

Rest and relax in this peaceful oasis perched on the edge of the river, which features plush mattresses, sophisticated wood furnishings, and spacious closets so you can unpack and stay for a while. In the bathroom, you’ll find masterful tile work and modern fixtures - plus towels and toiletries provided for your convenience.

After a day at the Metropolitan Museum of Art, a matinee show on Broadway, or a packed agenda of meetings, you’re bound to be hungry, Cook up a storm in the full kitchen, which features stainless steel appliances, including a full-size fridge and freezer, an electric stove, an oven, a microwave, and a dishwashe
host_about:
We have been providing vacation rental apartments for over 10 years across the East Coast. We are known for our distinctively furnished apartments in popular locations, and for our attentive service. You’ll find that our rates are quite reasonable. If you're looking for a safe, comfortable place with fabulous amenities and Wi-Fi (we know you need the Wi-Fi!) in the Boston MA area, Washington DC, Miami FL or very close to NYC in Jersey City or Hoboken, we'd love to host you. Many of the buildings where our apartments are located feature amenities such as beautiful lobbies, 24 hour front desk staff, fitness centers, business centers, recreation rooms, indoor or outdoor pools and whirlpools. If you are traveling with children, some buildings offer playgrounds (many buildings are near public playgrounds as well) or indoor playrooms. Depending on the location, you can stay for just a few days, a week, a month or more. 

We offer an assortment of short-term apartments in sizes ranging from a studio to three bedrooms that are fully furnished with all the comforts of home. Our local staff meticulously prepares your apartment before your arrival, and we offer 24 hour assistance for any emergencies after business hours. When you arrive at your apartment, the beds will be made, towels and bath amenities will be stocked in the bathrooms, and the coffee maker will be set up in the kitchen with some sample coffees, sweetener and creamer (teabags too if that is your preference) to start your morning off properly. If you’d like to cook a meal, the kitchen is stocked with dishes, cutlery, glassware and pots and pans. The living room is set up with a TV and cable channels, and the Wi-Fi router password and instructions will be prominently displayed so you can get connected quickly. You can also make local and toll-free phone calls at no charge. 

Please contact us to confirm the exact availability of the apartment you are interested in. We’d love to host you (and your family) for your vacation or business trip.
neighbourhood: Jersey City, New Jersey, United States

name: Rental unit in Jersey City · ★4.88 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
The neighborhood is safe and trendy. It’s a great neighborhood for New York City commuters and travelers as well as for those that want to enjoy a bit more calmness than Manhattan while being minutes away from it.

Aside from the proximity to the underground transportation with Manhattan and other parts of New Jersey, you will have in less than 5 minutes walk a large diversity of exciting cafes, restaurants, bars, shops, yoga studios, gyms and a great supermarket (Keyfood).

In less than 15 minutes walk you will reach a large shopping mall, a multiplex movie theater, several parks, and the riverside with some of the best views in the New York Metropolitan Area. If you want more shopping, next to the Newport Mall, you can find Shoprite, BJ’S Wholesale, Bed Bath & Beyond, The Home Depot and Target.

Enjoy this studio, that accommodates 2 people. It also includes wifi and TV.
host_about: Spanish architect with offices in New York, Miami, Madrid, and Chennai. Passionate about traveling and understanding other ways of living and thinking. I had the fortune to live and work on five continents. I use Airbnb to both host and travel as a guest.
neighbourhood: Jersey City, New Jersey, United States

They have three 20 somethings - real New Yorkers, smart, sassy and worldly.  And they travel often to see their family in California, Israel, France and Germany.  Come and stay with us!

name: Home in Jersey City · ★4.52 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 3 shared baths
neighborhood_overview:
Downtown Jersey City's Grove Street area is a vibrant and bustling neighborhood. It is known for its mix of residential, commercial, and entertainment offerings, making it a popular destination for residents and visitors alike.

Grove Street serves as the main hub of this neighborhood, lined with a variety of shops, restaurants, cafes, and bars. The area has a lively atmosphere with a diverse array of cuisines, ranging from cozy brunch spots to upscale dining experiences. It's a great place to explore and discover unique flavors from around the world.
One of the key attractions of the Grove Street area is its accessibility, particularly due to the presence of the Grove Street PATH train station. It provides convenient transportation options for residents commuting to Manhattan and other parts of New Jersey. It offers a direct connection to the World Trade Center in Lower Manhattan, making it a popular choice for professionals working in New York City.

You are

I'm a young professional living in New York Area. Very clean and Tidy.

name: Rental unit in Jersey City · ★4.53 · 1 bedroom · 3 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Jersey City Heights, often simply called The Heights, is a pleasant, somewhat densely packed residential neighborhood in the northern section of Jersey City, which in turn is the second-largest city in the state of New Jersey.

Homes in the area can be most often found in the two- and three-family detached houses which sit on small lots and which dominate the housing stock here, or in the low-rise apartment buildings that also are a considerable presence in the neighborhood. There are also more than a few stately old Victorian and Edwardian houses scattered throughout the streets of the Heights with rental apartments within, especially on Sherman Place and Summit Avenue.

Rental apartments in The Heights are generally considered to be located in the area that's bordered to the south by the Bergen Arches rail tracks and The Divided Highway (also known as the Pulaski Skyway, or Route 139); to the east by Palisade Avenue (and the city of Hoboken); to the north by Patte
host_about: I worked on Wall Street for more them twenty-five years, and one of the things I loved the most about my job was the flexibility the company gave me when traveling around the world. We are very friendly and always love to have guests in our apartments in Jersey City Heights. Most of the time we are traveling to new places. As an avid traveler, I enjoy providing others with an affordable and comfortable place to stay.  Thank you so much God bless.

neighborhood_overview:
- Not a greatest neighborhood in Jersey City. We are one Light Rail stop off from the most developed/expensive part of JC (and the contrast is quite clear). You will notice graffiti as well as bars covering the windows (but the crime rate is not at all high compared to surrounding area including downtown JC based on public statistics). Some of our guests were not comfortable being in the neighborhood and it took for our family to get used to it.
- The neighborhood could be noisy due to freight railway that passes nearby and a neighbor who plays loud music outside every few Saturday.
- Limited supermarkets and restaurants availability (a few small convenient stores in the neighborhood but, for a decent supermaket, you will have to take light rail to Hudson Greene Market near Exchange Place station.)

name: Rental unit in Jersey City · ★4.89 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
"The Heights" is a diverse neighborhood in Jersey City. Local grocery, limited restaurant/deli and liquor stores are within a 5-20 minute walk. There are also two urban parks, Pershing Field and Gordon Park, that are a quick walk from the house. Pershing field has playground equipment, tennis courts and other amenities.

Please note "the Heights" is not in the downtown area of Jersey City that borders the Hudson River. The Heights is primarily residential, rather than a commercial neighborhood. You can reach Jersey City's waterfront via 2 subway stops, Grove Street or Exchange Place or take a taxi there.

If you want local 'action' in the evening, this is probably not the right property for you. If you want a large number of trendy restaurants, bars, high end shops within a 5 minute walk, this is probably not the right property for you.

Our listing is in a residential, quiet neighborhood.

name: Home in Jersey City · ★4.46 · 1 bedroom · 4 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Jersey City, New Jersey, United States

This city is full of history and quaint restaurants and bars that earned it its nickname as “The Wall Street West”. The historic downtown has many million-dollar brownstones and row houses filled with charming historical 1800’s characteristics. Jersey City just recently spent 7 million dollars upgrading its main upscare pedestrian walkway downtown area with all stores and restaurants. A super fast commute to NYC with many restaurants and boutiques: walk to the subway and ride just 5 minutes to NYC World Trade Center.

The house, built in 1856, is located in Downtown Jersey City with a lot to offer: Cafés, Restaurants ( Orale - Mexican cuisine Razza Pizza), Bars (Dullboy, The Ashford), Pharmacies ( CVS, Walgreens, Medly), and just minutes to Hudson River Waterfront Walkway (walk along the water and enjoy stunning views of NYC). Reserve your seat at the Wally Wall, Manhattan Yacht Club's floating clubhouse in the harbor.
host_about:
HI, we are New York Native, Mom and Dad, we have two beautiful children. we love travelling and enjoy nature and community service.

we have been hosting for 5 years and we are blessed to have one more place to offer my returning guests, as well as some new ones.
It was a joy putting this home together and we hope you will love what we did with the place!

The park boasts river-front views, a 9-hole golf course, tennis courts, bird sanctuary, and a grand fountain recently restored to its original glory (designed by Pierre J. host_about:
We have been providing vacation rental apartments for over 10 years across the East Coast. We are known for our distinctively furnished apartments in popular locations, and for our attentive service. You’ll find that our rates are quite reasonable. If you're looking for a safe, comfortable place with fabulous amenities and Wi-Fi (we know you need the Wi-Fi!) in the Boston MA area, Washington DC, Miami FL or very close to NYC in Jersey City or Hoboken, we'd love to host you. Many of the buildings where our apartments are located feature amenities such as beautiful lobbies, 24 hour front desk staff, fitness centers, business centers, recreation rooms, indoor or outdoor pools and whirlpools. If you are traveling with children, some buildings offer playgrounds (many buildings are near public playgrounds as well) or indoor playrooms. Depending on the location, you can stay for just a few days, a week, a month or more. 

We offer an assortment of short-term apartments in sizes ranging from a studio to three bedrooms that are fully furnished with all the comforts of home. Our local staff meticulously prepares your apartment before your arrival, and we offer 24 hour assistance for any emergencies after business hours. When you arrive at your apartment, the beds will be made, towels and bath amenities will be stocked in the bathrooms, and the coffee maker will be set up in the kitchen with some sample coffees, sweetener and creamer (teabags too if that is your preference) to start your morning off properly. If you’d like to cook a meal, the kitchen is stocked with dishes, cutlery, glassware and pots and pans. The living room is set up with a TV and cable channels, and the Wi-Fi router password and instructions will be prominently displayed so you can get connected quickly. You can also make local and toll-free phone calls at no charge. 

Please contact us to confirm the exact availability of the apartment you are interested in. We’d love to host you (and your family) for your vacation or business trip.
neighbourhood: Jersey City, New Jersey, United States

Townhouse in Jersey City · ★4.75 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 shared bath
neighborhood_overview:
Downtown Jersey City is a vibrant and diverse community of neighborhoods. Lots of restaurants and drinking establishments and food shops. Citi Bike stands are only a few blocks away in any direction from the house.

With the PATH train only a few blocks away, access into NYC is on a 24/7 basis. Both uptown to 33rd St and downtown to WTC.

On-street parking: No Parking for non-residents from 8:30am to 5pm daily. OK for weekends. Even with a parking permit, parking is very limited. There is alternative street cleaning.

neighborhood_overview: People from New York have shown a tendency to move to Jersey City Heights, because it provides all the comfort and accessibility without having to pay the extra fees that comes from living in the big city.  Security video camera so you can feel secure at my property. Street parking requires a daily $5.00 permit from Monday through Friday). Cars are constantly moving around. Watch out for street cleaning signs where you have to move your car to the opposite side of the street. Mondays and Thursdays one side. Tuesdays and Fridays the opposite side. Street is  cleaned from 10-12noon. No street cleaning happens on Wednesdays or weekends. You can buy your parking permit at the parking authority which is two blocks away (open 8:30-5:00pm M-F) you will need a copy of the reservation, car registration and the application form which i left copies in the apartment.
host_about:
Greetings, 
I work in the Healthcare Care Compliance industry. I  thrived in customer satisfaction by accommodating your needs within my capacity.  I joined airbnb community in July 2016. Of all attributes, the open communication with my guests is priceless. While your privacy and comfort are my goals, I am available to guide you through your stay. Remember: This is your home-away-from-home and  I am happy to host you.

name: Serviced apartment in Jersey City · ★4.50 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: Leave the busy, hectic commute behind. Once you step inside this plush, brand new modern high rises, the taxing day fades and you can concentrate on all the stunning on-site amenities. host_about:
We have been providing vacation rental apartments for over 10 years across the East Coast. We are known for our distinctively furnished apartments in popular locations, and for our attentive service. You’ll find that our rates are quite reasonable. If you're looking for a safe, comfortable place with fabulous amenities and Wi-Fi (we know you need the Wi-Fi!) in the Boston MA area, Washington DC, Miami FL or very close to NYC in Jersey City or Hoboken, we'd love to host you. Many of the buildings where our apartments are located feature amenities such as beautiful lobbies, 24 hour front desk staff, fitness centers, business centers, recreation rooms, indoor or outdoor pools and whirlpools. If you are traveling with children, some buildings offer playgrounds (many buildings are near public playgrounds as well) or indoor playrooms. Depending on the location, you can stay for just a few days, a week, a month or more. 

We offer an assortment of short-term apartments in sizes ranging from a studio to three bedrooms that are fully furnished with all the comforts of home. Our local staff meticulously prepares your apartment before your arrival, and we offer 24 hour assistance for any emergencies after business hours. When you arrive at your apartment, the beds will be made, towels and bath amenities will be stocked in the bathrooms, and the coffee maker will be set up in the kitchen with some sample coffees, sweetener and creamer (teabags too if that is your preference) to start your morning off properly. If you’d like to cook a meal, the kitchen is stocked with dishes, cutlery, glassware and pots and pans. The living room is set up with a TV and cable channels, and the Wi-Fi router password and instructions will be prominently displayed so you can get connected quickly. You can also make local and toll-free phone calls at no charge. 

Please contact us to confirm the exact availability of the apartment you are interested in. We’d love to host you (and your family) for your vacation or business trip.

neighborhood_overview:
Jersey City Heights is a lively and safe neighborhood located in Jersey City, New Jersey, just across the Hudson River from Manhattan. Known for its vibrant atmosphere and scenic views, it has become a popular destination for residents and visitors alike.

One of the defining features of Jersey City Heights is its elevated location, which provides breathtaking panoramic views of the Manhattan skyline and the Hudson River. Residents and visitors can enjoy stunning vistas from various vantage points throughout the neighborhood, offering a unique perspective on the iconic New York City skyline.

The area offers a wide range of culinary options. From cozy cafes to trendy restaurants, you'll find an array of cuisines to satisfy your palate.

name: Home in Jersey City · ★4.95 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 private bath
neighborhood_overview:
Jersey city has been noted as the most diversely populated city in the country.
It's a busy city but safe, short walk to the path train or bus terminal to take you to NYC in 10 mins. Popular fast food chains available locally, also some excellent independently owned restaurants. Feel free to ask for any suggestions. Newark avenue also known as little India is where you'll be transported into a street in Mumbai and get excellent cuisine. Downtown Jersey city offers some of the best cuisine and dining experiences on the East coast. TimeOut magazine has Ani Ramen, Batello, Dull boy and Hamilton Pork listed as best eats and the list goes on. The waterfront also offers an amazing view of the NYC skyline and additional dining options. With Lady Liberty on your left the ferries going into NYC are also a great sightseeing travel alternative. Liberty Science Center, liberty state park and Ellis island are also minutes away. With NYC as a famous backdrop Jersey City is also a very notable

name: Serviced apartment in Jersey City · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Why stay in Manhattan when you can savor the peace and quiet of this luxurious Jersey City high-rise? Away from the hustle and bustle of Times Square and Fifth Avenue, this Downtown Jersey City building is a better value than anything you’d find across the Hudson - and you can still get to NYC in minutes via the ferry or the PATH train.

Rest and relax in this peaceful oasis perched on the edge of the river, which features plush mattresses, sophisticated wood furnishings, and spacious closets so you can unpack and stay for a while. In the bathroom, you’ll find masterful tile work and modern fixtures - plus towels and toiletries provided for your convenience.

After a day at the Metropolitan Museum of Art, a matinee show on Broadway, or a packed agenda of meetings, you’re bound to be hungry, Cook up a storm in the full kitchen, which features stainless steel appliances, including a full-size fridge and freezer, an electric stove, an oven, a microwave, and a dishwashe

neighborhood_overview: Jersey City is the second most populous city in the state of New Jersey. Located just across the Hudson River from Lower Manhattan, it’s part of the New York metropolitan area. The city’s architecture ranges from Industrial Age homes to classic brownstones to modern high rises. Downtown Jersey City, a major historical district, overlooks the Manhattan skyline. The waterfront section of the city is nicknamed “Wall Street West” for being home to several employers in the financial services, securities and insurance industries. The lofty office buildings, including the highly distinctive Goldman Sachs Tower, create a stunning skyline. With its proximity to Manhattan, Jersey City is popular among young professionals working in New York City looking for an alternative to living in one of the five boroughs. name: Rental unit in Jersey City · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: Neighborhood is filled with high rise buildings. Very clean and quiet neighborhood overlooking the Manhattan skyline. You have access to the Newport Boardwalk where you can go running or for a walk with the most gorgeous view of the Manhattan skyline. There is a park about 2 blocks away and Komegashi is a very good restaurant if you like Sushi. Newport Mall is right around the corner as well, where there are multiple dining options.
host_about:
I'm an aspiring minimalist, well rounded and passionate about Public Speaking. I enjoy encouraging people to step out of their comfort zone.

In my free time, I like playing pool, exploring neighborhoods, playing badminton or bowling. I also enjoy kicking back and catching up on movies and TV shows. I love table tennis. On the adventurous side, I have been Sky Diving and want to try bungee jumping/scuba diving sometime.

name: Guest suite in Jersey City · ★4.89 · Studio · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Great restaurants downtown Jersey City (20 minute walk), cafes and shops are nearby as well. 2 different options for parking: $10/day parking in a driveway near our house or Journal Square Path subway has a big lot, check online for current pricing. Please let us know when booking if you will need parking so we can reserve the driveway for you.

There are also two Citi Bike Stations (Bike sharing program) within 5-7 minutes walk (Jefferson Avenue and Beacon Avenue). Great way to get around and there are stations downtown Jersey City, at Liberty State Park and all over so you can check out everything and not have to worry about parking.
host_about: Born and raised in Southern California, now living in Jersey City with my amazing husband. I love dogs, coffee and barbells. I love singing and dancing and sometimes do it professionally.

name: Rental unit in Jersey City · ★4.37 · 1 bedroom · 3 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Jersey City Heights, often simply called The Heights, is a pleasant, somewhat densely packed residential neighborhood in the northern section of Jersey City, which in turn is the second largest city in the state of New Jersey.

Homes in the area can be most often found in the two- and three-family detached houses which sit on small lots and which dominate the housing stock here, or in the low-rise apartment buildings that also are a considerable presence in the neighborhood. There are also more than a few stately old Victorian and Edwardian houses scattered throughout the streets of the Heights with rental apartments within, especially on Sherman Place and Summit Avenue.

Rental apartments in The Heights are generally considered to be located in the area that's bordered to the south by the Bergen Arches rail tracks and The Divided Highway (also known as the Pulaski Skyway, or Route 139); to the east by Palisade Avenue (and the city of Hoboken); to the north by Patt

As an avid traveler, I enjoy providing others with an affordable and comfortable place to stay.  Thank you so much God bless.

name: Rental unit in Jersey City · ★4.94 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: Jersey City is the second most populous city in the state of New Jersey. Located just across the Hudson River from Lower Manhattan, it’s part of the New York metropolitan area. The city’s architecture ranges from Industrial Age homes to classic brownstones to modern high rises. Downtown Jersey City, a major historical district, overlooks the Manhattan skyline. The waterfront section of the city is nicknamed “Wall Street West” for being home to several employers in the financial services, securities and insurance industries. The lofty office buildings, including the highly distinctive Goldman Sachs Tower, create a stunning skyline. With its proximity to Manhattan, Jersey City is popular among young professionals working in New York City looking for an alternative to living in one of the five boroughs. It is also one of the most ethnically diverse cities in the world, with large populations of Hispanic, Asian and Indian Americans. The Port Authority Trans-Hudson (PATH) train, a 24-hour s

name: Home in Jersey City · ★4.47 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 2 shared baths
neighborhood_overview:
Journal Square is a vibrant and bustling neighborhood, known for its central transportation hub and rich cultural heritage.

At the heart of Journal Square is the Journal Square Transportation Center, a major transportation hub connecting various forms of transit, including buses, trains, and PATH (Port Authority Trans-Hudson) trains. This central location makes it a convenient hub for commuting to New York City and other parts of New Jersey, attracting a diverse range of residents and visitors.
Journal Square is a melting pot of cultures, offering a vibrant tapestry of ethnic diversity. This is reflected in the variety of cuisines, shops, and markets found throughout the neighborhood. From Indian and Middle Eastern eateries to Latin American and Caribbean flavors, there is no shortage of culinary delights to explore. You can also find an array of local shops, markets, and specialty stores that cater to diverse tastes and preferences.

name: Rental unit in Jersey City · ★4.98 · Studio · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Historic Downtown Jersey City is brimming with activity! With its close proximity to NYC, the area has seen a rapid development in the past 7 years and is now home to a diverse mix of locals, restaurants, bars and businesses. Just take a look on Yelp and you will find over 50 places to eat and drink at that are rated 4 STARS and above, all within a 10 minute walk from the apartment! In addition, there is Newport Mall nearby, which has a lot of shopping options (H&M, Zara, Coach, G-Star, Macys, Footlocker to name a few) a cinema and a diverse food court.

In our opinion, there are only 3 areas in New Jersey that are worth staying in if you are visiting NYC for a vacation or for business. Downtown Jersey City, Historic Jersey City and Hoboken due to their transport links to Manhattan, great local bars and restaurants, and for being known as incredibly safe areas.

Journal Square is still developing and very rough around the edges, with few bars and restaurants to

name: Rental unit in Jersey City · ★4.69 · 1 bedroom · 3 beds · 1 shared bath
neighborhood_overview:
Overlooking Hoboken and the Manhattan skyline, Jersey City Heights is becoming a go-to spot for new residents and tourists alike. It was previously an independent municipality that formally became part of Jersey City in 1870. Offering luscious green parks, the Riverview Arts District and bustling thoroughfares dotted with shops and restaurants, it’s clear the Heights is making its name as a premier destination. The house is located on a quiet and safe tree-lined street with direct access to Citi Bike and shopping and restaurants located on Central Avenue.
Jersey City Heights is very diverse neighborhood – Spanish, Italian, Indian, Asian, and many other ethnicities and a variety of food choices. The area has become a destination for young professionals, working in Manhattan and living in Jersey City, NJ. There is a large mix of many ethnicities and many people are choosing to live in Jersey City because of it and the low cost compared to Manhattan. You get the best of both worlds w

name: Rental unit in Jersey City · ★4.82 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1.5 shared baths
neighborhood_overview:
Overlooking Hoboken and the Manhattan skyline, Jersey City Heights is becoming a go-to spot for new residents and tourists alike. It was previously an independent municipality that formally became part of Jersey City in 1870. Offering luscious green parks, the Riverview Arts District and bustling thoroughfares dotted with shops and restaurants, it’s clear the Heights is making its name as a premier destination. The house is located on a quiet and safe tree-lined street with direct access to Citi Bike and shopping and restaurants located on Central Avenue.
Jersey City Heights is very diverse neighborhood – Spanish, Italian, Indian, Asian, and many other ethnicities and a variety of food choices. The area has become a destination for young professionals, working in Manhattan and living in Jersey City, NJ. There is a large mix of many ethnicities and many people are choosing to live in Jersey City because of it and the low cost compared to Manhattan. You get the best of both worlds w

name: Home in Jersey City · ★4.94 · 3 bedrooms · 9 beds · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview:
Jersey City is a gem with the best view of the Manhattan skyline and a 7 min drive to the Statue of Liberty! Hoboken, home of Carlo's Bakery, is our next door neighbor. Our neighborhood is especially family friendly and walkable. Enjoy tennis, picnicking, bike trails and multiple playgrounds, all within a 3-minute walk from your home away from home. Just around the corner is a Catholic church, an array of ethnic eateries, a Dairy Queen, convenience stores, fruitstands, hair salons, etc.

We are also close to Liberty State Park, where you can catch a ferry to the Statue of Liberty, Ellis Island, or to NYC!
host_about:
We are the parents of three young adults, and former foster parents; Mike is a professor and Kennan teaches at a cancer hospital in NYC. We consider ourselves to be committed to our community. 
We speak Spanish (though we are rusty).  Kennan can sign (though she is rusty too). But we would love to get some practice. 
We find great joy in hosting people and families from all over the world!

name: Rental unit in Jersey City · ★4.90 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Bergen-Lafayette is an urban neighborhood offering a diverse mix of residents, sights, and activities. This is a decent neighborhood and is generally safe. Please remember you are in Jersey City, not all of its streets are lined with charming brownstones and upscale restaurants. Some blocks, like ours, will give you extra entertainment in the form of the occasional loud boombox or kids playing lively games of hide and seek on the street.

Uber is very popular in Jersey City, and a ride between the apartment and the PATH station at Exchange Place in Downtown won't cost more than $10. They will take a group of 4 people, which means your cost per-person will be lower than the $2.5 light rail ticket. If you haven't used Uber before, let me know and I will send you an invite which comes with a small discount.

name: Home in Jersey City · ★4.71 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 shared bath
neighborhood_overview:
Jersey City Heights is a lively and safe neighborhood located in Jersey City, New Jersey, just across the Hudson River from Manhattan. Known for its vibrant atmosphere and scenic views, it has become a popular destination for residents and visitors alike.

One of the defining features of Jersey City Heights is its elevated location, which provides breathtaking panoramic views of the Manhattan skyline and the Hudson River. Residents and visitors can enjoy stunning vistas from various vantage points throughout the neighborhood, offering a unique perspective on the iconic New York City skyline.

The area offers a wide range of culinary options. From cozy cafes to trendy restaurants, you'll find an array of cuisines to satisfy your palate.

In terms of transportation, Jersey City Heights offers convenient access to public transit options. The Journal Square Transportation Center provides connections to PATH trains, buses, and light rail, making it easy to navi

neighborhood_overview:
Like the majority of affordable Airbnb listings in Jersey City and Brooklyn, our Tiny House is located in an up and coming neighborhood, further away from the crazy. As it consist of mostly residential houses, it’s quite and friendly. There is a grocery store and a few restaurants a couple of blocks away, and that specific street is in the middle of a gentrification process, but it’s totally safe.
The Lincoln Park around the corner is charming and my personal favorite thing about the neighborhood.
Get away from the busy and noisy Manhattan streets once you’ve enjoyed touristing around and enjoy a walk or morning jog in Lincoln Park! 👟🌳🌸

Street parking is easy to find ( a NYC metro area easy though, please keep that in mind:) )

Getting to NYC is easy peasy!
It takes 25min+ to get to Manhattan, depending on how you decide to get there.

Like driving?
It's about a bit 20 minute drive to get to Manhattan with no traffic.

host_about:
We have been providing vacation rental apartments for over 10 years across the East Coast. We are known for our distinctively furnished apartments in popular locations, and for our attentive service. You’ll find that our rates are quite reasonable. If you're looking for a safe, comfortable place with fabulous amenities and Wi-Fi (we know you need the Wi-Fi!) in the Boston MA area, Washington DC, Miami FL or very close to NYC in Jersey City or Hoboken, we'd love to host you. Many of the buildings where our apartments are located feature amenities such as beautiful lobbies, 24 hour front desk staff, fitness centers, business centers, recreation rooms, indoor or outdoor pools and whirlpools. If you are traveling with children, some buildings offer playgrounds (many buildings are near public playgrounds as well) or indoor playrooms. Depending on the location, you can stay for just a few days, a week, a month or more. 

We offer an assortment of short-term apartments in sizes ranging from a studio to three bedrooms that are fully furnished with all the comforts of home. Our local staff meticulously prepares your apartment before your arrival, and we offer 24 hour assistance for any emergencies after business hours. When you arrive at your apartment, the beds will be made, towels and bath amenities will be stocked in the bathrooms, and the coffee maker will be set up in the kitchen with some sample coffees, sweetener and creamer (teabags too if that is your preference) to start your morning off properly. If you’d like to cook a meal, the kitchen is stocked with dishes, cutlery, glassware and pots and pans. The living room is set up with a TV and cable channels, and the Wi-Fi router password and instructions will be prominently displayed so you can get connected quickly. You can also make local and toll-free phone calls at no charge. 

Please contact us to confirm the exact availability of the apartment you are interested in. We’d love to host you (and your family) for your vacation or business trip.
neighbourhood: Jersey City, New Jersey, United States

host_about:
Traveling around the planet and experiencing new cultures and places is a true passion of mine. When I travel, I love to immerse myself in the people and environment. I love learning how to cook new cuisine, explore the outdoors (hiking/kayaking), and visit museums and parks. 

As a guest, I am courteous and treat the home/apartment as my own. I enjoy receiving advice/recommendations from airbnb hosts, so please feel free to let me know what are the must dos/sees in your city!

If you have any questions, please feel free to ask!

name: Rental unit in Jersey City · ★4.86 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
The apartment is located in the historic neighborhood of Hamilton Park in downtown Jersey City. The apartment is two blocks away from the park, which has tennis courts, a basketball court, a large playground, plenty of tree-shaded grassy areas for a picnic, and a farmer’s market on Wednesdays from May through November.

Newark Avenue, a pedestrian-only street with lots of trendy restaurants and bars, is an 8-minute walk away.

The Newport Mall, with plenty of shopping options and a large movie theater, is three blocks away.

There are a number of restaurants, as well as some great ice cream shops and several local coffee shops, within close walking distance. There are also two grocery stores located within five blocks of the apartment (ShopRite and Key Food).

name: Home in Jersey City · ★4.67 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 shared bath
neighborhood_overview:
Jersey City Heights is a lively and safe neighborhood located in Jersey City, New Jersey, just across the Hudson River from Manhattan. Known for its vibrant atmosphere and scenic views, it has become a popular destination for residents and visitors alike.

One of the defining features of Jersey City Heights is its elevated location, which provides breathtaking panoramic views of the Manhattan skyline and the Hudson River. Residents and visitors can enjoy stunning vistas from various vantage points throughout the neighborhood, offering a unique perspective on the iconic New York City skyline.

The area offers a wide range of culinary options. From cozy cafes to trendy restaurants, you'll find an array of cuisines to satisfy your palate.

name: Townhouse in Jersey City · ★4.82 · 5 bedrooms · 5 beds · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is very safe and full of character. The house is located across from the newly built Journal Squared Tower and 2 blocks away from the Jehovah Witness Kingdom Hall in Journal Square. It is actually located in the center of Journal Square. There are numerous grocery stores, bakeries, coffee shops and restaurants steps away. Restaurants/ cafe and Bar are within just a few minutes walk, as well as Star Bucks and the Dunkin' Donuts. You have access to Jersey City's Little India on Newark Avenue, just a few blocks away. Try some local flare or take a walk to the PATH station to go downtown or into Manhattan! WE ARE 3 TRAIN STOPS AWAY FROM DOWN TOWN MANHATTAN!!!
host_about: I was born and raised in India where I received my formal education. I am currently a physical therapist and have been practicing for the past 30 years. My beloved husband, Yonel, was born and raised in Haiti. He holds a PhD in public affairs and administration. He has been a full time government employee for the past 29 years and a part time adjunct professor at Rutgers University. We both enjoy the hospitality business and do our best to make our guests feel at home.  In our spare time, we enjoy cooking and gardening with our children.  Please  come stay a while and enjoy our home.

name: Serviced apartment in Jersey City · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview:
Why stay in Manhattan when you can savor the peace and quiet of this luxurious Jersey City high-rise? Away from the hustle and bustle of Times Square and Fifth Avenue, this Downtown Jersey City building is a better value than anything you’d find across the Hudson - and you can still get to NYC in minutes via the ferry or the PATH train.

Rest and relax in this peaceful oasis perched on the edge of the river, which features plush mattresses, sophisticated wood furnishings, and spacious closets so you can unpack and stay for a while. In the bathroom, you’ll find masterful tile work and modern fixtures - plus towels and toiletries provided for your convenience.

After a day at the Metropolitan Museum of Art, a matinee show on Broadway, or a packed agenda of meetings, you’re bound to be hungry, Cook up a storm in the full kitchen, which features stainless steel appliances, including a full-size fridge and freezer, an electric stove, an oven, a microwave, and a dishwashe
host_about:
We have been providing vacation rental apartments for over 10 years across the East Coast. We are known for our distinctively furnished apartments in popular locations, and for our attentive service. You’ll find that our rates are quite reasonable. If you're looking for a safe, comfortable place with fabulous amenities and Wi-Fi (we know you need the Wi-Fi!) in the Boston MA area, Washington DC, Miami FL or very close to NYC in Jersey City or Hoboken, we'd love to host you. Many of the buildings where our apartments are located feature amenities such as beautiful lobbies, 24 hour front desk staff, fitness centers, business centers, recreation rooms, indoor or outdoor pools and whirlpools. If you are traveling with children, some buildings offer playgrounds (many buildings are near public playgrounds as well) or indoor playrooms. Depending on the location, you can stay for just a few days, a week, a month or more. 

We offer an assortment of short-term apartments in sizes ranging from a studio to three bedrooms that are fully furnished with all the comforts of home. Our local staff meticulously prepares your apartment before your arrival, and we offer 24 hour assistance for any emergencies after business hours. When you arrive at your apartment, the beds will be made, towels and bath amenities will be stocked in the bathrooms, and the coffee maker will be set up in the kitchen with some sample coffees, sweetener and creamer (teabags too if that is your preference) to start your morning off properly. If you’d like to cook a meal, the kitchen is stocked with dishes, cutlery, glassware and pots and pans. The living room is set up with a TV and cable channels, and the Wi-Fi router password and instructions will be prominently displayed so you can get connected quickly. You can also make local and toll-free phone calls at no charge. 

Please contact us to confirm the exact availability of the apartment you are interested in. We’d love to host you (and your family) for your vacation or business trip.
neighbourhood: Jersey City, New Jersey, United States

name: Townhouse in Jersey City · ★4.97 · 4 bedrooms · 6 beds · 2.5 baths
neighborhood_overview:
Jersey City is close to NYC and has a variety of public transportation options. Neighboring Hoboken and downtown Jersey City are both easy 15 minute walks and have plenty of lovely options for dining and entertainment. 20 minutes from Newark airport.

We are 6 miles from MetLife stadium, home to the Giants and Jets. Appr. 15 minutes via Uber or car.

We provide maps and bus/train instructions for NYC travel. The fastest to Herald Square (Macys's) is (a) 16 min walk to PATH at Journal Square, then 20 min train to 33rd street. Or take 3 minute bus to PATH for faster service. PATH drops at Christopher Street, 9th street, 14th street (Union Square), 23rd street and 33rd street (Macy's). There is also a separate Path Service line directly to the World Trade Center (about 10 minutes on the train).

There are also direct buses that get you to Times Square (Port Authority) in about 35 to 45 minutes that pickup directly outside of our street.
host_about: Hello future friends - my husband, Ted, and I love traveling the world. (So much that we have been to Norway, New Orleans, London, Maine, Austin, Nashville, Toronto, Hawaii, Croatia, Venice, Switzerland, South Africa, Alaska, Portland and Napa in recent years.)  I hail from the midwest (Wisconsin) and love ice cream, cheese and the Packers.  Ted is from Brooklyn and knows everything about NYC + he was an MLB baseball player. We live for country music, half marathons and live music.  We hope to see you at our home or yours! Our goal as Airbnb hosts is to give a purely local and delightful home-away-from-home. See you soon!
neighbourhood: Jersey City, New Jersey, United States

name: Rental unit in Jersey City · ★4.93 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
The neighborhood is very safe and family friendly. Like NYC, the neighborhood is cultural diversity. Jersey City has been gentrifying for the last few years.  We have seen an influx of young professionals and families like ourselves move into this beautiful, vibrant city. We have lived in Jersey City for nine years with our three young kids (5,8,10) and Tim's family has been here for 100+ years.

A couple of blocks from us is an elementary school, catholic high school, Saint Peter's University, churches, and the New Jersey National Guard Armory.

There is a grocery store, wine shop, diners/restaurants right around the corner. One of the best bagel places in the NYC/NJ area is just a few blocks away. An amazing local favorite breakfast spot, Cafe Alice is a block from us. Little India, a 15-minute walk away, has some of the best restaurants around and there are plenty of dining options closer to Journal Square.

Our house is:
-1/2 mile (7 blocks) f
host_about:
When we are not busy raising and hanging out with our kids (5,8,10) we love to travel and being outdoors. This is one of our favorite places - beautiful aqua blue water and white sandy beaches in Kailua, Hawaii and Koster Islands, Sweden.

We have been hosting for five years now.  Our hosting experience has definitely expanded our worldview and appreciation of other cultures.
neighbourhood: Jersey City, New Jersey, United States

Local entrepreneurs have opened trendy coffee shops, art galleries, and boutiques, adding to the neighborhood's vibrancy. This blend of old and new creates a dynamic and evolving landscape that appeals to both longtime residents and newcomers alike.
Bergen-Lafayette also boasts a thriving food scene, with an array of culinary options reflecting the diverse cultural influences present in the area. You can find everything from traditional soul food to global cuisine, making it a destination for food lovers seeking unique dining experiences.

The neighborhood's green spaces are another highlight. neighborhood_overview:
Check out my guidebook for recommendations!
The Journal Square area is old and gaining ground with occasional classic films playing at the historic Loews Theater across from the Path Station.
•The Mana Contemporary Art Center is around the corner.
•Square 1 Community cafe is 2 doors down serving excellent food and coffees, drinks etc.
•Little India is a block away with shopping, fresh food, butchers and excellent restaurants.
•Convenience stores like the Dollar Store, a liquor store and small ethnic markets are easily available. There are ashrams as well and a yoga studio.
•Grove Street (Path station stop) is chock full of new restaurants that are delicious and now pedestrian in some areas. Shops and nightlife abound if you decide to stay in Jersey City. Jivamukti has an excellent yoga studio there as well.
•Exchange Place (Path station) has a direct ferry to Brookside Place (near WTC and the Oculus).
•Liberty State Park is a short ride away an

name: Rental unit in Jersey City · ★4.98 · 2 bedrooms · 3 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
We love our neighborhood for the perfect balance of walkability, diversity, and livability. Smart travelers already know Downtown Jersey City is closer to Manhattan than 95% of Queens and Brooklyn with considerably less crowds. Plus our mayor is young and progressive and fully legalized airbnb in 2015, unlike NYC where is very much illegal for short term rentals. Our waterfront has one of the most picturesque views of lower Manhattan, New York Harbor and Statue of Liberty.

The apartment is two short blocks away from Hamilton Park surrounded by gorgeous brownstones and 19th century rowhouses, and it is adorned with impressive 100+ year old trees and lush glass within that often serve as gathering place for locals and visitors alike - the park hosts weekly farmers market, seasonal movie screenings, barbecue festivals, tennis and basketball courts, just to name a few.

Many shopping and restaurants options are all walking distance from the apartment and a
host_about: Grew up in NYC, settled down in Jersey City.   I worked in tech, ran a wine shop, am a classically trained cook and social media hermit.   While first hosting airbnb I realized hospitality and food have been my calling all along so I work very hard everyday towards perfecting my craft while trying to be the best family man I can be.

host_about:
Hi, I'm Miz!

I have lived in the NYC area for 8 years, and have been sharing my space (now spaces!) with guests since 2014. I love hosting!

I grew up in Houston, Texas, went to college in Pennsylvania, and spent time living in Italy, Spain, and Australia before moving to NYC. I currently live in Jersey City.

I am a real estate agent and property manager, and in my spare time I enjoy long walks in the neighborhood, wandering around NYC, all the self-care (massages, facials, yoga), and eating out (plus a good cocktail) with friends. 

I'm an avid traveler and have stayed with friends all over the world. I love to get a local experience when I travel, so I'm happy to provide that for my guests. My partner Mario and I host together, so you may hear or see him as well! 

Any and all questions welcome! I want to make sure you have a great time in Jersey City & NYC.

host_about:
I am young, 'trendy' (try to be) professional living in New York.  I moved to NY one year ago from London, although I'm originally from Australia. 

My style of Airbnb-hosting is to provide an extremely high standard - the best service and 'space' that I can, so that my guests enjoy themselves to the fullest.  Over the last few years I have had the pleasure of staying in many Airbnb places all around the world; and I have had wonderful experiences.  Now I want to return the favor, I want you to feel like you are in a 5 Star Hotel.   

Briefly about my career... Two years ago I moved out of the 'Start-up field' to start my own business in Real Estate, and haven't looked back since.  

My motto in life is cliche but true: You can get anything you want in your life as long as you put your heart and mind into it, whilst at the same time having a strong sense of integrity.

Jersey City is a melting pot of international influences from its residents to its varied and appetizing culinary options - Korean, Indian, Filipino, Cuban, Italian, and American.

The Statue of Liberty and Ellis Islands are less than ½ mile away from Liberty State Park’s ferry dock. Liberty Science Center is a 10 minutes drive from Urban Base Camp. There are beautiful green spaces - Hamilton Park, Van Vorst Park, and Liberty Park - where kids can frolic and play, where you can walk, run, and cycle, take a picnic and gaze upon Manhattan’s skyline. The Newport area - one stop from Grove PATH station - offers you a mall, large stores, and a beautiful waterfront walkway.

name: Rental unit in Jersey City · 2 bedrooms · 3 beds · 1 bath
Home in Jersey City · ★4.70 · 3 bedrooms · 5 beds · 1.5 baths
neighborhood_overview:
Guests will be located close to everything in a very safe neighborhood. The area is very unique where you can encounter very cool findings (Restaurants, coffee shops, vintage stores, etc.) You'll be located two blocks away from the Palisade Ave. & Prospect St. bus stops, where you will be able to easily take buses to many tourists attractions.

Jersey City Heights is a residential neighborhood with some Victorian and Edwardian homes, The Heights has multicultural restaurants, cafes, and ice cream shops along Central Avenue. Adjacent to a large reservoir, Pershing Field features an indoor skating rink and swimming pool, while Leonard Gordon Park is known for its early-1900s buffalo and bears statues by sculptor Solon Borglum. Washington Park offers sports courts and a playground.
neighbourhood: Jersey City, New Jersey, United States

name: Condo in Jersey City · ★5.0 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 shared bath
Condo in Jersey City · ★4.47 · 2 bedrooms · 3 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Jersey City Heights, often simply called The Heights, is a pleasant, somewhat densely packed residential neighborhood in the northern section of Jersey City, which in turn is the second largest city in the state of New Jersey.

Homes in the area can be most often found in the two- and three-family detached houses which sit on small lots and which dominate the housing stock here, or in the low-rise apartment buildings that also are a considerable presence in the neighborhood. There are also more than a few stately old Victorian and Edwardian houses scattered throughout the streets of the Heights with rental apartments within, especially on Sherman Place and Summit Avenue.

Rental apartments in The Heights are generally considered to be located in the area that's bordered to the south by the Bergen Arches rail tracks and The Divided Highway (also known as the Pulaski Skyway, or Route 139); to the east by Palisade Avenue (and the city of Hoboken); to the north by Patt
host_about: I worked on Wall Street for more them twenty-five years, and one of the things I loved the most about my job was the flexibility the company gave me when traveling around the world. We are very friendly and always love to have guests in our apartments in Jersey City Heights. Most of the time we are traveling to new places. As an avid traveler, I enjoy providing others with an affordable and comfortable place to stay.  Thank you so much God bless.
neighbourhood: Jersey City, New Jersey, United States

Discover a tranquil and secure neighborhood that welcomes a rich tapestry of diverse ethnicities and cultures. While primarily home to professionals and full-time workers, it also embraces the essence of a close-knit family community.

name: Rental unit in Jersey City · ★4.64 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath
Rental unit in Jersey City · ★4.86 · 4 bedrooms · 4 beds · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview:
While the majority of our guests come to see NYC, we urge you to explore Jersey City’s beautiful Bergen Lafayette as well. Within 10 minutes of the apartment you will find an array of hip new restaurants, bars, and cafes located on the evolving Communipaw Avenue. Grind Coffee Shop is a must if you are a coffee fan. Three blocks from the house is the new Berry Lane Park - host to regular soccer matches and tennis games. Don’t forget to visit Downtown Jersey City for local gems like Torico Ice Cream Shop and Taqueria Downtown.

Bergen-Lafayette is an urban neighborhood offering a diverse mix of residents, sights, and activities. This is a decent neighborhood and is generally safe. Please remember you are in Jersey City, not all of its streets are lined with charming brownstones and upscale restaurants. Some blocks, like ours, will give you extra entertainment in the form of the occasional loud boombox or kids playing lively games of hide and seek on the street.

Agai
host_about: Passionate traveler & Airbnb host.  Love all things design.

name: Rental unit in Jersey City · ★4.66 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 3 shared baths
neighborhood_overview: Just across the river from Manhattan, Jersey City is considered the sixth borough of New York City. There are frequent buses to Times Square just a short walk away from the apartment. Buses run every 10 minutes. There are plenty of local restaurants nearby with diverse and delicious cuisine.
host_about:
Hi, I'm Miz!

I have lived in the NYC area for 8 years, and have been sharing my space (now spaces!) with guests since 2014. I love hosting!

I grew up in Houston, Texas, went to college in Pennsylvania, and spent time living in Italy, Spain, and Australia before moving to NYC. I currently live in Jersey City.

I am a real estate agent and property manager, and in my spare time I enjoy long walks in the neighborhood, wandering around NYC, all the self-care (massages, facials, yoga), and eating out (plus a good cocktail) with friends. 

I'm an avid traveler and have stayed with friends all over the world. I love to get a local experience when I travel, so I'm happy to provide that for my guests. My partner Mario and I host together, so you may hear or see him as well! 

Any and all questions welcome! I want to make sure you have a great time in Jersey City & NYC.
neighbourhood: Jersey City, New Jersey, United States

name: Home in Jersey City · ★4.78 · Studio · 2 beds · 1 shared bath
neighborhood_overview:
Jersey City is the 6th borough of NYC and super convenient to Manhattan. The house is two blocks away from Central Ave. This is a street full of cheap shopping, restaurants, coffee shops all along the sidewalk. You also will catch the bus to Port Authority in NYC here.

There is also Riverview Park park located four blocks away on 498 Palisade Ave. If you want to go for a scenic walk definitely include this! There a farmers market at Riverview Park which is held every Sunday (rain or shine) from the first Sunday in May through the Sunday before Thanksgiving in November, from 10 am to 3 pm.
host_about: We are a husband and wife team in Jersey City and have been hosting our home outside of the NYC area for the last several years. We love hosting travelers from all over the world. We are here to make sure you have an amazing stay. Welcome home, enjoy your stay!
neighbourhood: Jersey City, New Jersey, United States

neighborhood_overview: There are good coffee, organic ice cream, and other food choices around the area. name: Rental unit in Jersey City · ★4.93 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Our street is primarily young families, very quiet and safe, so please no loud parties. It is as close as you can be to the Path into Manhattan (3 blocks) and walking distance to all the amazing restaurants and bars downtown without the noise.
Please ask us about where to go, we are happy to share our insiders' knowledge.
host_about:
My husband and I have lived in Jersey City for 20 years.  We love our area because of its convenience to NYC. In fact, my colleagues that live in Brooklyn take longer to get to work than I do!  
We love to travel with our three young daughters and love to stay in Airbnbs.  As a host I try to provide anything that I would want to have when traveling. We want to make your stay as comfortable and enjoyable as possible.  From advice on where to go or eat, to breakfast items for our late night arrivals... always something to make you feel welcome!
neighbourhood: Jersey City, New Jersey, United States

name: Condo in Jersey City · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: Bergen Lafayette is Jersey City’s coolest neighborhood for diversity, inclusiveness, restaurants, bars, cafes, etc. Affectionately known as “Bela” the area is open to people from all walks of life, dog friendly, walkable to parks, to downtown JC, to light rails for quick commute. Into fitness? Great run in the park, play basketball around the corner and visit many of the local gyms. For traveling nurses multiple hospitals within 5min-30min away
host_about:
We love diversity, culture, art, creatives.  We can't live without good food, music, warm weather, and a beach/pool. Favorite travel destinations so far Dubai, Greece, Mexico (Tulum), Colombia & South Africa.  We typically travel together but love when friends join.  No matter where or with who #1 is cleanliness  #2 access and security (safe area) #3 high speed internet, wifi, bluetooth etc. and #4 location to transportation, shopping, dining and nightlife. 

So as Airbnb Host we want to provide a great experience for solo travelers, couples and groups alike! We look forward to hosting and welcoming all guest in our hometown of Jersey City! 

The Liberty Suite Team

name: Serviced apartment in Jersey City · ★4.70 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Why stay in Manhattan when you can savor the peace and quiet of this luxurious Jersey City high-rise? Away from the hustle and bustle of Times Square and Fifth Avenue, this Downtown Jersey City building is a better value than anything you’d find across the Hudson - and you can still get to NYC in minutes via the ferry or the PATH train.

Rest and relax in this peaceful oasis perched on the edge of the river, which features plush mattresses, sophisticated wood furnishings, and spacious closets so you can unpack and stay for a while.
