name: Place to stay in Jersey City · ★4.82 · 1 bed · 1 shared bath
neighborhood_overview:
We are a Century’s old Guest/Rooming House that has been renovated. We offer European style rooms with shared bathrooms and Continental styled rooms with private bathrooms.
All rooms have microwave ovens, mini refrigerators, desk and chair, Iron, blow dryer, heat and air conditioning (in the summer and spring), sheets, comforter, towels, shampoo, conditioner, body wash, plastic utensils, plates, bowls, cups, toilet paper and free Wi-Fi.
We also have a laundry room for your use (for a fee) on premises and we will provide you with a refillable laundry card.

The property is clean, safe and secure and is located in a quiet tree-lined residential neighborhood only one block from 24 hour Journal Square ( JSQ) PATH train station. In the PATH station there is a 24 hour Deli/Café and several Deli, coffee shops and stores within walking distance as well as the local police station.
neighbourhood: Jersey City, New Jersey, United States

name: Rental unit in Jersey City · ★4.86 · 2 bedrooms · 3 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Located just across the Hudson River from New York City, some refer to Jersey City as the sixth borough. Overlooking Hoboken and the Manhattan skyline, Jersey City Heights is a go-to spot for tourists.
Due to its location, one hundred feet above sea level on the western side of the Hudson River, residents get to enjoy beautiful scenic views of the Manhattan skyline from one side and beautiful marshes and meadowlands on the other side. Variety of public transportation options like the PATH Train, New Jersey Transit’s  Light Rail, and public buses make your traveling to New York City, downtown Jersey City, or Hoboken quick and convenient. Take the stairs off Paterson Plank Road to Hoboken’s 2nd Street Light Rail Station or the elevator at Congress Street to the 9th Street Light Rail Station to easily commute around Hoboken, Weehawken, Jersey City, Bayonne and beyond! New Jersey Transit bus routes also serve this neighborhood, with several major lines to help you zip around locally

name: Home in Jersey City · ★4.50 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
The neighborhood has experienced a revitalization, with new businesses, restaurants, and cultural venues sprouting up. Local entrepreneurs have opened trendy coffee shops, art galleries, and boutiques, adding to the neighborhood's vibrancy. This blend of old and new creates a dynamic and evolving landscape that appeals to both longtime residents and newcomers alike.
Bergen-Lafayette also boasts a thriving food scene, with an array of culinary options reflecting the diverse cultural influences present in the area. You can find everything from traditional soul food to global cuisine, making it a destination for food lovers seeking unique dining experiences.

The neighborhood's green spaces are another highlight. Berry Lane Park, a large and beautifully designed public park, provides a tranquil oasis where residents can enjoy outdoor activities, picnics, and community gatherings. It serves as a hub for recreational opportunities and offers a respite from the bustling city.<

neighborhood_overview:
Located just across the Hudson River from New York City, some refer to Jersey City as the sixth borough. Jersey City's Heights section exemplifies convenient, commuter friendly living in a timeless charming neighborhood! Overlooking Hoboken and the Manhattan skyline, Jersey City Heights is a go-to spot for tourists.
Due to its location, one hundred feet above sea level on the western side of the Hudson River, residents get to enjoy beautiful scenic views of the Manhattan skyline from one side and beautiful marshes and meadowlands on the other side. Variety of public transportation options like the PATH Train, New Jersey Transit’s Light Rail, and public buses make your traveling to New York City, downtown Jersey City, or Hoboken quick and convenient. Take the stairs off Paterson Plank Road to Hoboken’s 2nd Street Light Rail Station or the elevator at Congress Street to the 9th Street Light Rail Station to easily commute around Hoboken, Weehawken, Jersey City, Bayonne and beyond! Apartment is located at Newport of Jersey City which is master-planned, mixed-use community in Downtown Jersey City, New Jersey,

Newport consists of retail, residential, office, and entertainment facilities. The neighborhood is situated on the Hudson Waterfront and located opposite Lower Manhattan and the neighborhood of Tribeca in New York City.

The apartment is just behind the Newport Centre Mall, a large traditional indoor shopping complex anchored by Macy's, JCPenney, Sears, Kohl's, H&M, and ZARA.

Outside the mall and around the Newport area are a variety of primarily neighborhood oriented restaurants and retail stores (known collectively as "The Newport River Market") including a number of notables such as a Target Staples and Best Buy

name: Rental unit in Jersey City · ★4.82 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
Rental unit in Hoboken · ★4.73 · 3 bedrooms · 4 beds · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview:
Just one-square-mile (2.5 square kilometers) in size, Hoboken is a small town with everything you love about city life. Washington Street is the main thoroughfare, lined with great restaurants, bars bistro-pubs and rooftop bars. Spend an afternoon exploring quaint cobblestone streets, where you’ll find one-of-a-kind boutiques.

Take in the stunning views of NYC as you bike or stroll along the Hudson River Waterfront Walkway, visiting parks and piers on with way. Join the free yoga class at Pier A or settle in for a movie under the stars at Pier 13 Park. Throughout the year, Hoboken hosts a wide range of concerts and a full schedule of festivals celebrating the arts and food—from Restaurant Week to The Mutz (Mozzarella) Festival. There’s a youthful energy here that’s infectious.
host_about: I love to live life.  Take this moment to experience a different place, a different outlook and experience the here and now! Be present and don't wait to live the life you want!

name: Rental unit in Jersey City · ★4.67 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: Jersey City is the second most populous city in the state of New Jersey. Located just across the Hudson River from Lower Manhattan, it’s part of the New York metropolitan area. The city’s architecture ranges from Industrial Age homes to classic brownstones to modern high rises. Downtown Jersey City, a major historical district, overlooks the Manhattan skyline. The waterfront section of the city is nicknamed “Wall Street West” for being home to several employers in the financial services, securities and insurance industries. The lofty office buildings, including the highly distinctive Goldman Sachs Tower, create a stunning skyline. With its proximity to Manhattan, Jersey City is popular among young professionals working in New York City looking for an alternative to living in one of the five boroughs. neighborhood_overview:
The neighborhood has experienced a revitalization, with new businesses, restaurants, and cultural venues sprouting up. Local entrepreneurs have opened trendy coffee shops, art galleries, and boutiques, adding to the neighborhood's vibrancy. This blend of old and new creates a dynamic and evolving landscape that appeals to both longtime residents and newcomers alike.
Bergen-Lafayette also boasts a thriving food scene, with an array of culinary options reflecting the diverse cultural influences present in the area. You can find everything from traditional soul food to global cuisine, making it a destination for food lovers seeking unique dining experiences.

The neighborhood's green spaces are another highlight. Berry Lane Park, a large and beautifully designed public park, provides a tranquil oasis where residents can enjoy outdoor activities, picnics, and community gatherings. It serves as a hub for recreational opportunities and offers a respite from the bustling city.<

name: Rental unit in Jersey City · ★4.92 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
Rental unit in Jersey City · ★4.86 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: The Grove Street area location of the apartment makes it extremely close to Manhattan via the PATH train. Ferries, a light rail (HBLR) and buses also provide additional access to NYC as well as local spots. The local neighborhood surrounding the apartment is just as interesting as NYC and everyone knows the best views of Manhattan are actually from the Jersey City waterfront (a great place for a stroll, run or photo op). Grove Street is just as convenient as Manhattan in many ways and you will find yourself a short walk from dozens of restaurants, bars and shops. The area boasts several parks (including Liberty State Park with Liberty Science Center as well as access to the Statue of Liberty and Ellis Island), ice rinks, Newport Mall (130 stores and a movie theater), boating, and performance venues.. Several farmer’s markets, craft fairs, live outdoor music, holiday events and a midnight foodie market lend to the local vibe. You will also find a huge amount of diversity in Jersey City,

This space is located in the Bergen-Lafayette fast growing gentrify area in Jersey City, it is a very popular, vibrant and diverse metro area just like NYC. Therefore, you will be able to find simple groceries in corner bodega stores, or access to supermarkets within 10-15 mins walk. The Hudson-Bergen light rail located 7 mins walk take you 2 PATH stations where you transfer to PATH train into NYC, the light rail also go to the Newport Mall in Jersey City directly for shopping.

Light rail ride is 15-20 mins ride, PATH ride is 2-15 mins depends on where you get off in NYC.

Direct bus into NYC Bus Port Authority (one block from Time Square) is 7 mins walk from the house.

Our commitment to safety extends to the property itself, equipped with 24/7 security cameras, providing you with the peace of mind you deserve. In over a decade of residence here, we've never encountered any safety concerns or incidents, a testament to the safety and serenity of our growing community.

Embrace the warmth and security of our neighborhood during your stay.

name: Rental unit in Jersey City · ★4.31 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Journal Square is a vibrant and bustling neighborhood, known for its central transportation hub and rich cultural heritage.

At the heart of Journal Square is the Journal Square Transportation Center, a major transportation hub connecting various forms of transit, including buses, trains, and PATH (Port Authority Trans-Hudson) trains. This central location makes it a convenient hub for commuting to New York City and other parts of New Jersey, attracting a diverse range of residents and visitors.
Journal Square is a melting pot of cultures, offering a vibrant tapestry of ethnic diversity. This is reflected in the variety of cuisines, shops, and markets found throughout the neighborhood. From Indian and Middle Eastern eateries to Latin American and Caribbean flavors, there is no shortage of culinary delights to explore. You can also find an array of local shops, markets, and specialty stores that cater to diverse tastes and preferences.

name: Rental unit in Jersey City · ★4.90 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Jersey City is part of Hudson County’s “Gold Coast,” a cluster of cities on the west bank of the Hudson River, located in NJ across from New York City. Jersey City is surrounded by other bustling urban areas – including NYC, Hoboken, and Weehawken. For a multi-city tour, hop on the PATH for a quick, 10 minute ride into our neighboring cities. Looking to check out the rest of the Gold Coast? Take the Light Rail up and down the Gold Coast into The Heights, McGinley Square, and Journal Square Jersey City; Hoboken, Weekhawken, and other notable cities/townships in Hudson County.

Want to stay closer to home? Downtown Jersey City is very walkable! We’re located right in Downtown, which is made up of many neighborhoods – all within walking distance of each other. From the the historic neighborhoods of Hamilton Park, Harsimus Cove, Powerhouse Arts District, The Village, and Van Vorst Park in Historic Downtown; to the modern neighborhoods of Exchange Place, Paulus Hook, and The Water

We both share a huge passion for travel, and we have been blessed to live and visit many places all over the world. Chris and I decided to root ourselves in the city that has so much to offer which is Jersey City. While settling here, we decided to give our fellow travel lovers a place that feels like home. With southern hospitality in our roots, we have a deep love for hosting, and we look forward to extending that love and warmth to our new friends.
Our modern, sun-drenched condo offers a tranquil vibe, which is perfect to come home to after a long day of exploring the city. This location is perfect for families who want to visit Jersey City  or New York area. The location is prime for any sports enthusiasts as we are a quick fifteen-minute drive to MetLife stadium—home of the New York Giants and New York Jets. The area is also suited for travel healthcare professionals, as we are near many hospitals including Jersey City hospital. Newark international airport is a quick twelve-minute drive and in thirty minutes you are in the BIG APPLE! New York City.

name: Home in Bayonne · ★4.79 · 3 bedrooms · 3 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: A suburbia-in-the city setting located on the south west perimeter of New Jersey Route 440 along Newark Bay, and borderline Jersey City.  Community consist of tree lined streets featuring Colonial, Cape Cod, and Ranch Styles homes. Area offers the convenience of city-living with an out of town feel. A short 15 minutes drive or Uber/Lyft ride from Newark International Airport.  Over the past twenty years, Jersey City and most recent Bayonne food scenes have exploded. From Thai to Mexican to Lebanese, multicultural influences have elevated both cities to a diverse and innovative foodie paradise. So whether you’re looking for an Indian restaurant or in the mood for Italian food, you’re guaranteed to find something to satisfy your tastebuds. From seafood to pasta to salad, breakfast, brunch, lunch, or dinner, both Jersey City and Bayonne got it all.

name: Rental unit in Jersey City · ★4.40 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Journal Square is a vibrant and bustling neighborhood, known for its central transportation hub and rich cultural heritage.

At the heart of Journal Square is the Journal Square Transportation Center, a major transportation hub connecting various forms of transit, including buses, trains, and PATH (Port Authority Trans-Hudson) trains. This central location makes it a convenient hub for commuting to New York City and other parts of New Jersey, attracting a diverse range of residents and visitors.
Journal Square is a melting pot of cultures, offering a vibrant tapestry of ethnic diversity. This is reflected in the variety of cuisines, shops, and markets found throughout the neighborhood. From Indian and Middle Eastern eateries to Latin American and Caribbean flavors, there is no shortage of culinary delights to explore. You can also find an array of local shops, markets, and specialty stores that cater to diverse tastes and preferences.

name: Rental unit in Jersey City · ★4.81 · 3 bedrooms · 4 beds · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview:
Jersey City Heights, often simply called The Heights, is a pleasant, somewhat densely packed residential neighborhood in the northern section of Jersey City, which in turn is the second-largest city in the state of New Jersey.

Homes in the area can be most often found in the two- and three-family detached houses which sit on small lots and which dominate the housing stock here, or in the low-rise apartment buildings that also are a considerable presence in the neighborhood. There are also more than a few stately old Victorian and Edwardian houses scattered throughout the streets of the Heights with rental apartments within, especially on Sherman Place and Summit Avenue.

Rental apartments in The Heights are generally considered to be located in the area that's bordered to the south by the Bergen Arches rail tracks and The Divided Highway (also known as the Pulaski Skyway, or Route 139); to the east by Palisade Avenue (and the city of Hoboken); to the north by Patte

We are very friendly and always love to have guests in our apartments in Jersey City Heights. Most of the time we are traveling to new places. As an avid traveler, I enjoy providing others with an affordable and comfortable place to stay.  Thank you so much God bless.

name: Rental unit in Jersey City · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: This furnished apartment is located in Jersey City, just across the Hudson River from Lower Manhattan.  Jersey City’s bustling waterfront is so  packed with office tours that it is affectionately known as “Wall Street West” among locals. In all, more than 100,000 people are employed within the city. Jersey City is home to its own  thriving international dining scene, including a number of fantastic Vietnamese restaurants and James Beard Award semifinalist Rick Easton’s Bread & Salt Bakery, where you can try some amazing Roman-style pizza. There are also plenty of shops around Journal Square and Newport Centre, a shopping mall located in nearby newport. Jersey City has excellent public transportation, with both express and local buses and a light rail system. The entire area is well connected to Manhattan via NJ Transit’s PATH train system, which runs 24/7 between several stops in Jersey City and 33rd Street and the World Trade Center in  Manhattan.
host_about:
We’re Blueground, a global proptech company with several thousand move-in-ready apartments in a growing number of major cities around the world. With flexible terms and homes in vibrant, centrally based neighborhoods, you’ll feel at home and free to roam for as long as you want — a month, a year, or longer. 

Each apartment is thoughtfully designed with exclusive furnishings, fully equipped kitchens, and incredible amenities – making every day a five-star experience. From day one, you’ll enjoy high-speed Wi-Fi, premium linens, and smart home entertainment. Plus, access to pools, gyms, and outdoor spaces in select buildings.

Why stress over your apartment? We provide a hassle-free alternative — a consistent, quality guest experience that starts even before you arrive. Because we let you book our most up-to-date apartment listings online, confirm with a click, pay securely, and check in easily. 

Even better? You can enhance your stay with car rentals, grocery delivery, laundry services, and more through our special partnerships. 

During your stay
Upon arrival, you’ll either be greeted personally by a Blueground team member or given self-check-in instructions. The entire apartment is yours! You’ll enjoy reliable support via email, phone, and our Guest App, where you can request everything from a home cleaning to extra towels. 

We’ll share all details upon confirmation of your stay.

We are two brothers with undeniable roots in the hospitality industry. With family working in hotels, most of our childhood was spent in a suitcase traveling from city to city and experiencing the best of travel. In fact, the true inspiration behind Sunset Stays was conceived from living in a hotel located on Sunset Blvd in Los Angeles.

Now, we have continued our family tradition by contributing to some of the best travel brands in the world. In our free time, we are true adventure seekers; staying at countless Airbnbs across the globe.

Coupling our background in the hospitality industry and as travelers, Sunset Stays is bringing the most seamless and comfortable experience for your next trip.

host_about:
Hi! I’m from Chicago and I live in Jersey City (Journal Square section) now.  I lived in Manhattan for a few years and when I was able to buy something I chose Jersey City. It’s  a very cool place and is a shorter trip to NYC than most of Brooklyn. I'm listing my place while I do some cosmetic work on the space upstairs (no noisy work).  I also travel quite a bit so I thought I would host. I’ve got a magical and freaky bald dog (I failed at my first time fostering. He never left.) so, of course, your pet is welcome. I’m Ukrainian and plan on signing up for the Airbnb refugee hosting program which I’m very excited about. I’m responsible and chill and like making people feel welcome. 
Good luck with your search!

name: Rental unit in Jersey City · ★5.0 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Perched atop the New Jersey Palisades, you will be staying in the popular Riverview Arts District (Jersey City Heights) overlooking Hoboken and the Manhattan skyline! This neighborhood is becoming a go-to spot for new residents and tourists alike.
A multitude of shops, a plethora of international restaurants, public transport, gyms, and parks are all a short walking distance away.

Oh, did we mention: one of the best NYC skyline views is just a 4 mins walk away from our place! -- but don't tell anyone -- this view spot is a local secret ;)
You can also enjoy yoga in the park, the farmer's market on Saturday and Sunday, and great coffee shops such as the iconic Modcup.
host_about:
Hi, I'm Gabriela, a Software Engineer, with a love for travel!
I travel a loooot for fun and for work, and stayed at many Airbnb's for extended periods of time, so I know how important it is to have the perfect place to call home away from home.

Now, I transitioned to the other side of the experience, as an Airbnb host. I hope to make your stay perfect and have used my own extensive experience to make sure that our place is (and has) everything  you will need while traveling! 

Feel free to reach out any time if you have question before or during your stay :)
neighbourhood: Jersey City, New Jersey, United States

name: Home in Jersey City · ★4.60 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 2 shared baths
neighborhood_overview:
The neighborhood has experienced a revitalization, with new businesses, restaurants, and cultural venues sprouting up. Local entrepreneurs have opened trendy coffee shops, art galleries, and boutiques, adding to the neighborhood's vibrancy. This blend of old and new creates a dynamic and evolving landscape that appeals to both longtime residents and newcomers alike.
Bergen-Lafayette also boasts a thriving food scene, with an array of culinary options reflecting the diverse cultural influences present in the area. You can find everything from traditional soul food to global cuisine, making it a destination for food lovers seeking unique dining experiences.

The neighborhood's green spaces are another highlight. Berry Lane Park, a large and beautifully designed public park, provides a tranquil oasis where residents can enjoy outdoor activities, picnics, and community gatherings. It serves as a hub for recreational opportunities and offers a respite from the bustling city.<

Family Owned Property Management Company LiveWorkandMore.

name: Home in Jersey City · ★4.80 · 3 bedrooms · 3 beds · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview: 5 mins from NYC Jersey City has a vibrant food scene and was named America's next great food city by Travel and Leisure. Pop into any of the many corner bars throughout this neighborhood. Each bar has a slightly different flavor (though most promise at least a beer and a bite to eat!) and every local swears loyalty to “their” beloved bar. Rising above Jersey City, the Heights boast truly spectacular views of the Manhattan skyline. As the sun sets on Riverview Fisk Park, unobstructed views allow you to take in the full splendor of the city’s lights. The Heights additionally boasts its own lush green fields in Pershing Field Park, aquatic diversions at the Reservoir, fresh adventures through the Riverview Farmers Market or strolls through the Riverview Arts District. The neighborhood is perched atop the New Jersey Palisades, overlooking Hoboken and the Manhattan skyline, Jersey City Heights is becoming a go-to spot for new residents and tourists alike.

neighborhood_overview:
Overlooking Hoboken and the Manhattan skyline is the "Heights" a neighborhood in Jersey City, NJ that's quickly becoming the go-to-spot for tourists. And why not? from Riverview-Fisk Park (nestled between Palisade and Ogden Ave) you can appreciate the views of the Hudson and the Manhattan skyline. For morning risers take a walk to the Park's Observation deck and watch the sunrise on the East over NYC, one of the most serene experiences the Heights has to offer.

Jersey City is the most ethnically diverse city in NJ and the country. This diversity can be found in the large variety of ethnic restaurant that call the Heights their home. Most of the restaurant, bars, coffee shops and parks can be found on Central Avenue with the trendier ones on Palisade Avenue. The neighborhood offers a lot of stores, supermarket, bars, restaurants, coffee shops, and parks all within walking distance.

One of the defining features of Jersey City Heights is its elevated location, which provides breathtaking panoramic views of the Manhattan skyline and the Hudson River. The area offers a wide range of culinary options. From cozy cafes to trendy restaurants, you'll find an array of cuisines to satisfy your palate.

Hi, I'm Miz!

I grew up in Houston, Texas, went to college in Pennsylvania, and spent time living in Italy, Spain, and Australia before moving to NYC. I currently live in Jersey City.

I am a real estate agent and property manager, and in my spare time I enjoy long walks in the neighborhood, wandering around NYC, all the self-care (massages, facials, yoga), and eating out (plus a good cocktail) with friends. 

I'm an avid traveler and have stayed with friends all over the world. I love to get a local experience when I travel, so I'm happy to provide that for my guests. My partner Mario and I host together, so you may hear or see him as well! 

Any and all questions welcome! I want to make sure you have a great time in Jersey City & NYC.

name: Rental unit in Jersey City · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: This furnished apartment is located in Jersey City, just across the Hudson River from Lower Manhattan.  Jersey City’s bustling waterfront is so  packed with office tours that it is affectionately known as “Wall Street West” among locals. In all, more than 100,000 people are employed within the city. Jersey City is home to its own  thriving international dining scene, including a number of fantastic Vietnamese restaurants and James Beard Award semifinalist Rick Easton’s Bread & Salt Bakery, where you can try some amazing Roman-style pizza. There are also plenty of shops around Journal Square and Newport Centre, a shopping mall located in nearby newport. Jersey City has excellent public transportation, with both express and local buses and a light rail system. The entire area is well connected to Manhattan via NJ Transit’s PATH train system, which runs 24/7 between several stops in Jersey City and 33rd Street and the World Trade Center in  Manhattan.
host_about:
We’re Blueground, a global proptech company with several thousand move-in-ready apartments in a growing number of major cities around the world. With flexible terms and homes in vibrant, centrally based neighborhoods, you’ll feel at home and free to roam for as long as you want — a month, a year, or longer. 

Each apartment is thoughtfully designed with exclusive furnishings, fully equipped kitchens, and incredible amenities – making every day a five-star experience. From day one, you’ll enjoy high-speed Wi-Fi, premium linens, and smart home entertainment. Plus, access to pools, gyms, and outdoor spaces in select buildings.

Why stress over your apartment? We provide a hassle-free alternative — a consistent, quality guest experience that starts even before you arrive. Because we let you book our most up-to-date apartment listings online, confirm with a click, pay securely, and check in easily.

Upon arrival, you’ll either be greeted personally by a Blueground team member or given self-check-in instructions. The entire apartment is yours! You’ll enjoy reliable support via email, phone, and our Guest App, where you can request everything from a home cleaning to extra towels.

Welcome to Jersey City Heights, a vibrant and diverse neighborhood that offers a unique blend of urban living and community charm. Situated atop the Palisades, this elevated neighborhood provides stunning views of the Manhattan skyline and the Hudson River.

Jersey City Heights is known for its tree-lined streets, historic brownstones, and a lively atmosphere. Explore Central Avenue, the main commercial corridor, where you'll find an array of local shops, restaurants, and cafes to satisfy your culinary cravings. From international cuisine to cozy coffee shops, there's something for every palate.

Nature enthusiasts will appreciate the neighborhood's proximity to several parks, such as Pershing Field Park, where you can enjoy green spaces, playgrounds, and sports facilities. Take a leisurely stroll or bike ride along the scenic Hudson River Waterfront Walkway, offering breathtaking views and a tranquil escape from the bustling city.

Jersey City Heights boa
host_about: Hey there, we're Zara, Brandon, and our adorable 11 month old Serena. We're thrilled to welcome you to our cozy home. As longtime residents of both Jersey City and the Big Apple, we've got some serious local knowledge to share. Whether you're a curious soul, a food enthusiast, or simply seeking the warmest hospitality in Jersey City, we've got you covered! We absolutely love hosting and look forward to making your stay as pleasant as can be!

The area offers a wide range of culinary options. From cozy cafes to trendy restaurants, you'll find an array of cuisines to satisfy your palate.

name: Condo in Jersey City · ★5.0 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 private bath
neighborhood_overview:
Downtown is best known and loved for its charming historical architecture. Four of the five historic districts are Downtown where beautiful brownstones beguile along tree-lined streets in Harsimus Cove and around namesake parks in neighborhoods like Van Vorst Park and Hamilton Park.

The condo is located in the downtown section called Paulus Hook. Tucked between Exchange Place and the Colgate Clock along the Hudson River, it is one of the most sought-after historic districts. There, you can find leafy side streets dotted with restaurants, shops, and magnificent brownstones.

Downtown offers the most transportation options with three PATH trains stations and three NY Waterway ferry stops, making the commute to NYC less than 10 minutes. Buses and the Hudson-Bergen Light Rail are accessible as well. Downtown is also the beating heart of the bar, restaurant, and retail scene, but neighborhoods farther out, originally built as suburbs of Jersey City, are just as enlive
host_about: Hey all I'm Sep —an NYC-based designer who loves chatting, wandering new streets, and treating my taste buds to some delightful cuisine. I'm a queer, tech-y who you’ll often find lost in museums, exploring  nooks of new cities, and hunting down the top spots for food and cocktails. I prioritize super clean spaces, fast internet, and smooth check-in processes.

name: Vacation home in Jersey City · ★4.33 · 2 bedrooms · 5 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Jersey City, New Jersey, United States

This city is full of history and quaint restaurants and bars that earned it its nickname as “The Wall Street West”. The historic downtown has many million-dollar brownstones and row houses filled with charming historical 1800’s characteristics. Jersey City just recently spent 7 million dollars upgrading its main upscare pedestrian walkway downtown area with all stores and restaurants. A super fast commute to NYC with many restaurants and boutiques: walk to the subway and ride just 5 minutes to NYC World Trade Center.

The house, built in 1856, is located in Downtown Jersey City with a lot to offer: Cafés, Restaurants ( Orale - Mexican cuisine Razza Pizza), Bars (Dullboy, The Ashford), Pharmacies ( CVS, Walgreens, Medly), and just minutes to Hudson River Waterfront Walkway (walk along the water and enjoy stunning views of NYC). Reserve your seat at the Wally Wall, Manhattan Yacht Club's floating clubhouse in the harbor.
host_about:

name: Rental unit in Jersey City · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: This furnished apartment is located in Jersey City, just across the Hudson River from Lower Manhattan.  Jersey City’s bustling waterfront is so  packed with office tours that it is affectionately known as “Wall Street West” among locals. In all, more than 100,000 people are employed within the city. Jersey City is home to its own  thriving international dining scene, including a number of fantastic Vietnamese restaurants and James Beard Award semifinalist Rick Easton’s Bread & Salt Bakery, where you can try some amazing Roman-style pizza. There are also plenty of shops around Journal Square and Newport Centre, a shopping mall located in nearby newport. Jersey City has excellent public transportation, with both express and local buses and a light rail system. The entire area is well connected to Manhattan via NJ Transit’s PATH train system, which runs 24/7 between several stops in Jersey City and 33rd Street and the World Trade Center in  Manhattan.
host_about:
We’re Blueground, a global proptech company with several thousand move-in-ready apartments in a growing number of major cities around the world. With flexible terms and homes in vibrant, centrally based neighborhoods, you’ll feel at home and free to roam for as long as you want — a month, a year, or longer. 

Each apartment is thoughtfully designed with exclusive furnishings, fully equipped kitchens, and incredible amenities – making every day a five-star experience. From day one, you’ll enjoy high-speed Wi-Fi, premium linens, and smart home entertainment. Plus, access to pools, gyms, and outdoor spaces in select buildings.

Why stress over your apartment? We provide a hassle-free alternative — a consistent, quality guest experience that starts even before you arrive. Because we let you book our most up-to-date apartment listings online, confirm with a click, pay securely, and check in easily. 

Even better? You can enhance your stay with car rentals, grocery delivery, laundry services, and more through our special partnerships. 

During your stay
Upon arrival, you’ll either be greeted personally by a Blueground team member or given self-check-in instructions. The entire apartment is yours! You’ll enjoy reliable support via email, phone, and our Guest App, where you can request everything from a home cleaning to extra towels. 

We’ll share all details upon confirmation of your stay.
neighbourhood: Jersey City, New Jersey, United States

name: Home in Jersey City · ★4.91 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 shared bath
neighborhood_overview:
Given Jersey City's proximity and accessibility by rapid transit to Manhattan, Jersey City is sometimes referred to as New York City's Sixth borough. Redevelopment of the Jersey City waterfront has made the city one of the largest centers of banking and finance in the United States and has led to the district and city being nicknamed Wall Street West. Our house is located between Jersey City's top schools - Saint Peter's University and New Jersey City University.

There’s a 24 hour 7-eleven and Walgreens 1 minute drive/6min walk from the house.
host_about: Hello, my name is Ana & host alongside my husband Josiah. I’m a Senior Program Manager working in Design & Engineering while he works in sports! I was born and raised in Jersey City and was inspired to share the wonder by creating cozy spaces that others can enjoy while experiencing everything this area has to offer. We love meeting new people and our goal is to make you feel at home. We're also huge foodies so we'll definitely share all our recommendations! Hablo español.

name: Rental unit in Jersey City · ★4.72 · 2 bedrooms · 4 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
McGinley Square is a vibrant neighborhood located in the heart of Jersey City, just a short distance from Manhattan. This bustling area boasts a diverse community with a rich history, offering visitors a unique blend of urban and suburban living. Here, you'll find a variety of restaurants, bars, and shops, along with easy access to transportation options like the PATH train from nearby Journal Square and bus lines throughout the area.

The square itself is at the intersection of two of the city's major thoroughfares, Montgomery Street, and Bergen Avenue. The area was named after Monsignor Roger McGinley, the builder of St. Aedans Church.

The neighborhood is home to several parks, including Lincoln Park, which features playgrounds, sports fields, and a public golf course. The Hudson River waterfront is just a short distance away, offering stunning views of Manhattan's skyline and plenty of opportunities for outdoor activities like jogging, cycling, and kayaking.

name: Townhouse in Jersey City · ★4.96 · 4 bedrooms · 4 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
This is a very diverse neighborhood located it a metropolitan area. Residents on our street are mostly working professionals and retirees. The home is located on a quiet one-way street not on the main road.

You may hear the occasional sounds of emergency vehicles passing by from time to time or the garbage truck doing its rounds on trash pickup nights.

There is only street parking available on a first come basis, no designated parking. Please do not block people's driveways or park by fire hydrants because you will be ticketed.

There is alternate side parking on street cleaning days. Please ensure you pay close attention to the signs posted showing cleaning days and times to avoid getting a ticket.
host_about: I come from a humble upbringing in Jamaica and migrated to the US after graduating high school. I am an Army veteran with over 21 years of active duty service in the United States Army. I am Ivy League educated, a Columbia University alumni. I am a people person, and believe in treating others the way I want to be treated. The fear of failure motivates me and I live by high standards. I look for positivity in all things and I seriously dislike negative energy, so don't bring it around me. I love the life I live and live the life I love. Lastly, I love my peace and I always "hunt the good stuff"

name: Rental unit in Jersey City · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview: This furnished apartment is located in Jersey City, just across the Hudson River from Lower Manhattan.  Jersey City’s bustling waterfront is so  packed with office tours that it is affectionately known as “Wall Street West” among locals. In all, more than 100,000 people are employed within the city. Jersey City is home to its own  thriving international dining scene, including a number of fantastic Vietnamese restaurants and James Beard Award semifinalist Rick Easton’s Bread & Salt Bakery, where you can try some amazing Roman-style pizza. There are also plenty of shops around Journal Square and Newport Centre, a shopping mall located in nearby newport. Jersey City has excellent public transportation, with both express and local buses and a light rail system. The entire area is well connected to Manhattan via NJ Transit’s PATH train system, which runs 24/7 between several stops in Jersey City and 33rd Street and the World Trade Center in  Manhattan.
host_about:
We’re Blueground, a global proptech company with several thousand move-in-ready apartments in a growing number of major cities around the world. With flexible terms and homes in vibrant, centrally based neighborhoods, you’ll feel at home and free to roam for as long as you want — a month, a year, or longer. 

Each apartment is thoughtfully designed with exclusive furnishings, fully equipped kitchens, and incredible amenities – making every day a five-star experience. From day one, you’ll enjoy high-speed Wi-Fi, premium linens, and smart home entertainment. Plus, access to pools, gyms, and outdoor spaces in select buildings.

Why stress over your apartment? We provide a hassle-free alternative — a consistent, quality guest experience that starts even before you arrive. Because we let you book our most up-to-date apartment listings online, confirm with a click, pay securely, and check in easily. 

Even better? You can enhance your stay with car rentals, grocery delivery, laundry services, and more through our special partnerships. 

During your stay
Upon arrival, you’ll either be greeted personally by a Blueground team member or given self-check-in instructions. The entire apartment is yours! You’ll enjoy reliable support via email, phone, and our Guest App, where you can request everything from a home cleaning to extra towels. 

We’ll share all details upon confirmation of your stay.

neighborhood_overview:
Greenville is located south of the West Side Branch of the Hudson-Bergen Light Rail and north of the city line with Bayonne, between the Upper New York Bay and the Newark Bay. It is a primarily residential area that consists mostly of one- and two-family homes and low-rise apartment buildings. The central core of Greenville, which is located between Garfield Avenue and West Side Avenue, is the busiest part of the neighborhood, with many small shops and businesses lining the streets.

One of the main thoroughfares in Greenville is Martin Luther King Jr. Drive, which runs through the heart of the neighborhood and provides access to many of its businesses and amenities. Other important roads in the area include Old Bergen Road and Danforth Avenue.

neighborhood_overview: JC Heights is a closely knit, ethnically diverse and bustling neighborhood. There is always a new store or pop-up-event happening, but there are many tried and true staples within a few blocks as well. The neighborhood is flanked by 2 commercial arteries, Central and Palisade Avenue, which is home to many restaurants and conveniences including bodegas, salons, dry cleaners, post-office, flower shop, dispensaries, pharmacies, Covid-testing centers, and shoes stores. Nearby Riverview and Washington Parks are the heart of outdoor life for our neighborhood with skyline views, green spaces for picnics and walks, dog parks, playgrounds, playing fields and splash pads. If we are lucky enough to host you between May and November, you can enjoy the bounties of the Riverview Farmer’s Market every Sunday and other seasonal fairs. Below are only some of our neighborhood favorites in a 10 block radius.  If you enjoyed a particular place in our neighborhood during your stay that is not on this list,

neighborhood_overview:
Journal Square is a vibrant and bustling neighborhood, known for its central transportation hub and rich cultural heritage.

At the heart of Journal Square is the Journal Square Transportation Center, a major transportation hub connecting various forms of transit, including buses, trains, and PATH (Port Authority Trans-Hudson) trains. This central location makes it a convenient hub for commuting to New York City and other parts of New Jersey, attracting a diverse range of residents and visitors.
Journal Square is a melting pot of cultures, offering a vibrant tapestry of ethnic diversity. This is reflected in the variety of cuisines, shops, and markets found throughout the neighborhood. From Indian and Middle Eastern eateries to Latin American and Caribbean flavors, there is no shortage of culinary delights to explore. You can also find an array of local shops, markets, and specialty stores that cater to diverse tastes and preferences.

We loved living in this apartment and this neighborhood and raised 3 children here for 22 years. It is very safe and women, including my wife and daughter, feel safe walking at night to the supermarket or bus stop to NYC/Hoboken (only 1 block away). It's a vibrant neighborhood full of restaurants and cuisines from around the world: Columbian, Peruvian, Italian, Mexican, Cuban, Japanese, Indian, Haitian, etc. Great upscale pub restaurant with a beautiful tree-covered courtyard and live music 4 blocks away, "The Hutton". One of the best Italian deli/pizza/bread/donut bakeries in the New York Area, "Bread N Salt," is 10 blocks away (New York Times review). The park across the street offers bike-sharing, tennis, basketball, running track, heated swimming pool, and an ice-skating/roller rink!

Jersey City Heights is a lively and safe neighborhood located in Jersey City, New Jersey, just across the Hudson River from Manhattan. Known for its vibrant atmosphere and scenic views, it has become a popular destination for residents and visitors alike.

One of the defining features of Jersey City Heights is its elevated location, which provides breathtaking panoramic views of the Manhattan skyline and the Hudson River. The area offers a wide range of culinary options. From cozy cafes to trendy restaurants, you'll find an array of cuisines to satisfy your palate.

neighborhood_overview:
Hoboken is located across the Hudson River, directly west of Manhattan’s Chelsea and West Village. Boasting unparalleled waterfront views of Manhattan, it has a unique city vibe with a small-town feel.

The area was originally inhabited by the Lenni Lenape indigenous people who cultivated the bountiful serpentine rock of Hoboken to carve pipes. Henry Hudson, the namesake of Hudson County and Hudson River, was the first European to lay claim to the land in 1609.

In the early 1900s, NJ Transit completed tracks to Manhattan, and many shipping lines used Hoboken as a terminal port. By 1927, the Holland Tunnel was built, allowing easier travel to and from Manhattan. The Lincoln Tunnel was completed 10 years after.

neighborhood_overview:
Jersey City Heights, often simply called The Heights, is a pleasant, somewhat densely packed residential neighborhood in the northern section of Jersey City, which in turn is the second-largest city in the state of New Jersey.

Homes in the area can be most often found in the two- and three-family detached houses which sit on small lots and which dominate the housing stock here, or in the low-rise apartment buildings that also are a considerable presence in the neighborhood. There are also more than a few stately old Victorian and Edwardian houses scattered throughout the streets of the Heights with rental apartments within, especially on Sherman Place and Summit Avenue.

Rental apartments in The Heights are generally considered to be located in the area that's bordered to the south by the Bergen Arches rail tracks and The Divided Highway (also known as the Pulaski Skyway, or Route 139); to the east by Palisade Avenue (and the city of Hoboken); to the north by Patte

name: Rental unit in Jersey City · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: Welcome to the vibrant heart of historic downtown Jersey City, a charming enclave where history and modernity blend seamlessly. Often referred to as 'Wall Street West', this bustling district is a hub of culture and commerce, offering a unique juxtaposition of quaint streets and soaring skyscrapers. Just a stone's throw from the dynamic energy of New York City, you'll find yourself enveloped in an atmosphere that's both exhilarating and serene. Whether you're exploring the rich tapestry of our local history, savoring the diverse culinary delights, or hopping on a quick train to find yourself amidst the iconic landmarks of Manhattan, Jersey City offers the best of both worlds. Experience the allure of urban life coupled with the warmth of a close-knit community. Your adventure starts here, in the heart of it all!

neighborhood_overview:
Van Vorst Park is a historic neighborhood located in downtown Jersey City, New Jersey, just west of the bustling Grove Street area. The neighborhood is named after the beautiful and centrally-located Van Vorst Park, which serves as a popular gathering place for locals.

The Van Vorst Park neighborhood is known for its tree-lined streets, beautiful brownstones, and historic architecture. Many of the homes in the area were built in the 19th century and have been meticulously restored and maintained over the years, giving the neighborhood a charming and elegant feel.

name: Home in Jersey City · ★4.86 · 3 bedrooms · 3 beds · 2.5 baths
neighborhood_overview:
The Bergen-Lafayette section of Jersey City is home to a number of great places to eat and drink. Whether you're looking for a quick bite to eat or a sit-down meal, there's something for everyone in this vibrant neighborhood.

Some of our favorite places to eat in Bergen-Lafayette include Pinwheel Garden, Mordi's Sandwich Shop, Martha's, and Harry's Daughter. Each of these restaurants has its own unique atmosphere and offers something different for diners.

The perfect place to start the day is The Grind Coffee Shop serving not just incredible coffee, but decadent baked goods.

Pinwheel Garden is a great spot for lunch or dinner. The restaurant has a garden-like setting with an outdoor patio that's perfect for enjoying a meal on a nice day. The menu features a variety of fresh, healthy, and delicious options, making it a great choice for those looking for a healthy meal.

Mordi's Sandwich Shop is a popular lunch spot for locals and visitors alik
neighbourhood: Jersey City, New Jersey, United States

Welcome to Journal Square, a vibrant and diverse neighborhood in Jersey City, just minutes away from Manhattan. Here's a guide to help you navigate and explore the surrounding area:

1. Transportation: Journal Square is well-connected, offering easy access to various transportation options. The Journal Square PATH station is the heart of the neighborhood, providing direct train service to midtown Manhattan and the World Trade Center. Additionally, there are numerous bus routes and light rail options, making it convenient to explore the entire region.

name: Rental unit in Jersey City · ★4.81 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Jersey City is a vibrant and bustling neighborhood known for its accessibility to NYC!

The Riverview Fisk Park is just a 10 minute walk away, offering breathtaking views of the Manhattan skyline. Other parks include Pershing Field, which has a community pool and tennis courts as well as the Leonard Gordon Park for amazing sunset views.

There are many convenience stores just a block away, as well as a Stop and Shop and Walgreens for your grocery and pharmacy needs.

You’ll find everything you need at Central Avenue, just a 10 minute walk away, which holds many restaurants, cafes and bakeries as well as discount stores and farmers markets.
neighbourhood: Jersey City, New Jersey, United States

name: Home in Jersey City · ★4.27 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
Townhouse in Jersey City · ★4.97 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1.5 baths
neighborhood_overview:
The street is in the Bergen-Lafayette area of Jersey City and is up and coming. Berry Lane park with its basketball and tennis courts is a five minute walk away. It is the one of the biggest recreational parks in Jersey City. There's also a baseball field and a football pitch, where you can watch people say soccer, rugby and football all through the week.

Liberty State park is also a 15 to 25 minute leisurely walk away from my house.

For information on good places to eat in the area, check out my guidebook.
To find out what is going on in New York City the week you're traveling you can look up Time Out NYC and New York Adventure Club.
host_about:
I am a branding expert and agency owner in the New York area. 

I'm very mild-mannered and easy going, I speak three languages fluently and three others not as much. I have been told that I am very neat and extremely considerate. I am also a stickler for promptness. My friends are from all over the country and the world, as I've done a bit of traveling, but not as much as I would love to.
neighbourhood: Jersey City, New Jersey, United States

name: Rental unit in Jersey City · ★4.80 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 bath
Home in Jersey City · ★5.0 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 private bath
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is near to the large beautiful Berry Lane Park, it’s an 8 min walk to the light-rail station to the PATH to NYC. There’s a corner store a few blocks away, an Irish Pub down the street, and several restaurants and cafes near Berry Lane Park.
host_about:
I love bright colors, thrift shops, and riding my pink vintage bike around the city. I’ve spent my 20’s + most of my 30’s working for vulnerable children in West Africa. I took a break, wrote a book, I speak about my experiences, do some communication consultant work + I’m raising my own little toddler boy.

My husband is a physician who works in New York City + New Jersey. He grew up in Ethiopia. He’s an avid Liverpool futbol fan! 

We are both committed to using our lives to make the world a better place.

I love community and sharing + I look forward to either staying with you or hosting you in our home.

Love,
Katie
neighbourhood: Jersey City, New Jersey, United States

name: Rental unit in Jersey City · ★3.80 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
Rental unit in Jersey City · ★4.80 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Nestled in the up-and-coming urban neighborhood of Bergen Lafayette, our retreat offers a prime location to explore the vibrant scene of Jersey City.

Immerse yourself in the local culture as you discover not only an array of culinary delights but also a variety of attractions and experiences. Like any city, it can get lively at times, with the energy of urban life filling the air. However, rest assured that our accommodations provide a comfortable retreat where you can relax and recharge.

As your hosts, we're here to ensure you have a memorable stay, providing you with personalized recommendations to make the most of your visit. Whether you're seeking local dining hotspots, insights into the neighborhood's transformation, or tips for exploring the city's attractions, we're dedicated to making your experience exceptional.
host_about: Hey there, we're Zara, Brandon, and our adorable 11 month old Serena. We're thrilled to welcome you to our cozy home. As longtime residents of both Jersey City and the Big Apple, we've got some serious local knowledge to share. Whether you're a curious soul, a food enthusiast, or simply seeking the warmest hospitality in Jersey City, we've got you covered! We absolutely love hosting and look forward to making your stay as pleasant as can be!
neighbourhood: Jersey City, New Jersey, United States

name: Rental unit in Jersey City · ★4.88 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview:
Nestled in a charming residential neighborhood, our luxurious 2-bedroom escape offers an ideal location for travelers seeking both tranquility and urban convenience. Designed for travelers without a vehicle, our haven is a short 6-minute stroll from the Journal Square PATH station, granting you quick access to midtown or downtown NYC in under 30 minutes door to door.

Just around the corner, you'll find Indian Town, a hub of diverse ethnic dining and unique shopping experiences. For coffee enthusiasts, the neighborhood boasts multiple inviting coffee shops, perfect for a delightful sip or a moment of relaxation.

Explore the dynamic cityscape, then retreat to the serene ambiance of our residential oasis, where the best of Jersey City is right at your doorstep.

name: Rental unit in Jersey City · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 shared bath
neighborhood_overview:
Conveniently located, our apartment offers easy access to the vibrant city of New York. The PATH train is just a 15-minute walk or a quick 5-minute Uber ride away, providing a hassle-free commute to iconic destinations such as the World Trade Center (only 25 minutes away) and the Empire State Building (just 35 minutes away). After a day of exploring, return to the comfort of your private room and relax in tranquility.

Nestled in the charming Hamilton Park neighborhood of Jersey City, our apartment allows you to experience the best of both worlds. Enjoy the peacefulness of tree-lined streets and the beauty of Hamilton Park, known for its historical significance and well-maintained green spaces. This family-friendly neighborhood offers a variety of dining options, cozy cafes, and boutique shops to explore. With its close proximity to Manhattan, you'll have the opportunity to immerse yourself in the bustling city life while enjoying the laid-back atmosphere of Hamilton Park.

Jersey City Heights is a lively and safe neighborhood located in Jersey City, New Jersey, just across the Hudson River from Manhattan. Known for its vibrant atmosphere and scenic views, it has become a popular destination for residents and visitors alike.

One of the defining features of Jersey City Heights is its elevated location, which provides breathtaking panoramic views of the Manhattan skyline and the Hudson River. Residents and visitors can enjoy stunning vistas from various vantage points throughout the neighborhood, offering a unique perspective on the iconic New York City skyline.

The area offers a wide range of culinary options. From cozy cafes to trendy restaurants, you'll find an array of cuisines to satisfy your palate.

name: Home in Jersey City · ★4.84 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1.5 baths
neighborhood_overview:
Downtown historic Jersey City is a smaller part of what constitutes Jersey City, namely the portion that is closer to Manhattan. In Jersey the subway is called the Path and from the Grove Street Station you can get to the amazing WTC station (also called the Oculus) in Manhattan in less than 15 minutes!

"Jersey City’s Grove Street area is only a seven-minute PATH train ride from Manhattan, but for years that brief journey has been ridiculed for its destination, an unpolished wasteland. But lately, the Grove Street area brings to mind the Smith Street corridor of Brooklyn about 20 years ago. The New Jersey area has blossomed with the opening of more than a dozen stylish restaurants, bars and shops, joining longtime establishments that help it retain a tempo slightly slower than that across the Hudson River. As if to punctuate the neighborhood’s appeal, a large swath of a bordering street, Newark Avenue, the site of several new hot spots, became a pedestrian-only thoroughfare

name: Rental unit in Jersey City · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 bath
host_about:
We are a group of three Italian American siblings:  Kali, Dru, and Ram.  All of us have our professional day jobs but we share a passion for family, cooking, and adventures. 
We are strong believers in the sustainable movement and we strive to be as eco friendly as  possible. We make all of our own furniture, art and other creations from reclaimed local materials! We are vegetarians and are starting a community garden on our property to distribute fresh produce to our guests and the local community. We also donate a portion of our proceeds to support our local community in providing food to the homeless. We look at AirBnB not only as a business venture, but a way to promote our beliefs in living green, healthy and happy! 
We have over 20 listings in the Jersey City area through AirBnB and we love meeting new and interesting people from all over the world everyday. We take great pride in going the extra mile to make all of our guests feel as if they were home by providing secure, clean and beautiful living spaces. We often host guest dinners where all of our guests can interact and enjoy some delicious vegetarian food and of course exchange some laughs and stories!

name: Condo in Jersey City · ★5.0 · 3 bedrooms · 5 beds · 2 baths
Rental unit in Jersey City · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1.5 baths
neighborhood_overview:
VAN VORST HOUSE is conveniently located in downtown Jersey City, New Jersey, which is in a historic, quiet, charming neighborhood full of brownstone homes and trees. Jersey City and Hoboken, in Hudson County, are sometimes referred to as the “Sixth Borough of New York City” given their proximity to Manhattan. Jersey City is the affordable alternative for NYC travel. Located one mile from lower Manhattan, it's easily accessible by PATH, ferry, bus or train. A shopper's paradise with no sales tax on clothing or shoes and 3.5 percent sales tax in our UEZ zones, which is one half the normal tax rate.

Our property is 3 blocks / less than 10 mins walk away from Grove St PATH station. The PATH train can take you to Downtown Manhattan in less than 10 minutes to World Trade Center / Oculus. Additionally, you can get to 9th Street, 14th Street, 23rd Street and 33rd Street within minutes with no traffic. The PATH trains run as frequently as every 5 minutes during the peak hours and eve
host_about: Lived in New Orleans for 5 years, I fell in love with Southern hospitality, the weather, and delicious food. I currently live in New York City, and always missed the sunshine and friendly people.  I designed and decorated my home with my full heart and I hope you will enjoy it as much as I do when you are visiting! :)

neighborhood_overview:
This dynamic area is known for its rich history, diverse community, and thriving cultural scene. Discover the neighborhood's cultural heritage at local landmarks, such as the historic Lafayette Park or the Afro-American Historical and Cultural Society Museum. These landmarks offer a glimpse into the neighborhood's past and its role in shaping the vibrant community we see today. Nature enthusiasts will appreciate the nearby greenspaces, including Berry Lane Park, where you can enjoy outdoor activities, a quick jog, picnics, and leisurely strolls amidst beautiful surroundings.

While you're here, don't miss the opportunity to uncover the hidden gems of Jersey City itself. Just a quick three-minute light rail stop away, you'll find yourself immersed in the breathtaking beauty of Liberty State Park, where you can revel in stunning views and reconnect with nature. neighborhood_overview:
Location! Location! Location!
A residential neighborhood with some Victorian and Edwardian homes, The Heights has multicultural restaurants, cafes, and ice cream shops along Central Avenue. Adjacent to a large reservoir, Pershing Field features an indoor skating rink and swimming pool, basketball court, tennis court, and playground. All public transportation is within 12-15 minutes of walking distance. The Heights is one of Jersey City, NJ's safest neighborhood.

name: Home in Jersey City · ★5.0 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: Located just across the Hudson River from New York City, Jersey City is ranked one of the most diverse cities in the US. It is the  most and booming area in New Jersey. Depending on what Jersey City neighborhoods you check out, you will find a thriving downtown or venture into quiet residential streets with great views and vast green spaces. Our neighborhood is Jersey City Heights also borders Hoboken which is also an amazing city with an incredible waterfront and you can take the Ferry to Nyc. Travel locally by bus or light rail train. Visit Newport Mall, a great bar/nightlife area in downtown near Grove Street.
host_about:
I am honored to be a Superhost and have been hosting many years it helps support my dreams and home improvement projects . I started out hosting since I am a touring musician. I also love being part of the Airbnb community! As a citizen of the world I would say I am an Artistic Creative minded Global Music Artist  and owner of a Local Boutique with a Mind, Body, Home and Spirit direction we offer classes from meditation to Reiki and healing/beauty services.

I am Laid Back like good vibes & people with kind energy. Looking forward to sharing a great space with you and meeting travelers . I think My home is pretty  artistic and unique, it is my passion to decorate and host! I have toured as a musician and for my Boutique travelled extensively both Nationally & Internationally.  I have stayed at Airbnb locations all over the world from boat houses to rice patty fields to major cities around the world. As a guest myself It helped me in creating a style that understands the needs of those who I host.  I host people from all over the world and put my heart in to it. I do my very best to ensure every guest has the best stay possible. Happy Booking! If one of my rooms is not available check my other listing. Positive Chi Awaits! #Airbnb

name: Rental unit in Jersey City · 2 bedrooms · 3 beds · 1 bath
host_about:
We are a group of three Italian American siblings:  Kali, Dru, and Ram.  All of us have our professional day jobs but we share a passion for family, cooking, and adventures. 
We are strong believers in the sustainable movement and we strive to be as eco friendly as  possible. We make all of our own furniture, art and other creations from reclaimed local materials! We are vegetarians and are starting a community garden on our property to distribute fresh produce to our guests and the local community. We also donate a portion of our proceeds to support our local community in providing food to the homeless. We look at AirBnB not only as a business venture, but a way to promote our beliefs in living green, healthy and happy! 
We have over 20 listings in the Jersey City area through AirBnB and we love meeting new and interesting people from all over the world everyday. We take great pride in going the extra mile to make all of our guests feel as if they were home by providing secure, clean and beautiful living spaces. We often host guest dinners where all of our guests can interact and enjoy some delicious vegetarian food and of course exchange some laughs and stories!

name: Rental unit in Jersey City · 3 bedrooms · 3 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Nestled along the picturesque shores of the Hudson River, Jersey City, NJ, stands as a vibrant and dynamic destination, offering a unique blend of urban energy and community charm. Just a stone's throw away from the iconic skyline of Manhattan, Jersey City boasts a personality all its own.

Cityscape:
The cityscape is a mosaic of architectural wonders, from historic brownstones to sleek modern skyscrapers. Take a stroll along the waterfront for breathtaking views of the Manhattan skyline, or wander through diverse neighborhoods each with its own character and cultural flair.

Cultural Melting Pot:
Jersey City proudly embraces its cultural diversity, creating a melting pot of flavors, traditions, and artistic expressions. Explore the diverse culinary scene, where global cuisines converge in a gastronomic celebration. The vibrant arts scene reflects the city's creative spirit, with galleries, performances, and street art adding color to the urban landscape.<

Whether you're a solo traveler, a couple seeking a romantic getaway, or a small family on vacation, our cozy and stylishly appointed apartment is the perfect home base for your Jersey City and NYC adventure.

Jersey City offers a diverse range of experiences and attractions, and our Airbnb listing puts you within mins of many of them. Here are some neighborhood highlights:

1. Waterfront Walkway: Take a short ride on the light rail and stroll along the picturesque Hudson River waterfront and take in stunning views of Manhattan. Don't forget to catch a mesmerizing sunset!

neighborhood_overview:
The apartment is located in the vibrant neighborhood of Journal Square in Jersey City, New Jersey. Known for its diverse community and lively atmosphere, Journal Square is a popular destination for both residents and visitors alike.

The area is a hub for transportation, with the Journal Square Transportation Center just a few blocks away. This makes it easy to access other parts of Jersey City, as well as Manhattan and other parts of New York City. There are also several bus stops and a PATH train station nearby.

In terms of entertainment and dining options, Journal Square has something for everyone. There are numerous restaurants serving a variety of cuisines, from Italian to Indian to Mexican. You'll also find plenty of cafes and bars, as well as a movie theater and a bowling alley.

For outdoor enthusiasts, there are several parks and green spaces in the area, including the large and beautiful Lincoln Park, which features sports fields, tennis courts,

name: Home in Jersey City · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 2 shared baths
Rental unit in Jersey City · ★5.0 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview:
Our home provides seamless access to NYC with multiple transportation options, including ferry, bus, PATH, and light rail. Two PATH stations are less than 10 minutes away for a quick 10-minute ride to Lower Manhattan, and the same goes for the ferry. Enjoy a picturesque view of the World Trade Tower and NYC's Skyline from our street. While we're close to NYC, our neighborhood offers peace and quiet, along with easy access to charming coffee shops and restaurants. We're also just a 15-minute drive from EWR without traffic.

Street parking is generally hassle-free, with visitor permits required Mon. - Fri. No parking on Thursdays (1pm - 3pm) for street cleaning, but no permits are needed on weekends/holidays. We can provide visitor digital permits for $10/day, with no personal information required, only your car's details.

NOTABLE & UNIQUE NEIGHBORHOOD CHARACTERISTICS
The way a neighborhood looks and feels when you walk or drive around it, from its setting, its buildings, and its flavor, can make all the difference. This neighborhood has some really cool things about the way it looks and feels as revealed by Neighborhood Scout's exclusive research. This might include anything from the housing stock to the types of households living here to how people get around.

Modes of Transportation
More people ride the bus in this neighborhood each day to get to work than 98.9% of U.S. neighborhoods.

Also, in the West Bergen neighborhood, 19.1% of people ride the train to work each day. This is a very high percentage compared to most places. In fact, NeighborhoodScout's analysis reveals that this is a higher level of train ridership than in 96.9% of the neighborhoods in America.

name: Rental unit in Jersey City · ★4.50 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Welcome to Journal Square, an exciting and bustling neighborhood located in Jersey City, New Jersey. This area is a perfect blend of old and new, with modern architecture and historic brick buildings coexisting seamlessly. The energy here is contagious, but at the same time calmer than downtown areas.

At the heart of the neighborhood, the intersection of John F. Kennedy Boulevard and Newark Avenue is abuzz with activity. There is an endless variety of restaurants, shops, and other businesses to explore, and the residents love the lively atmosphere.

One of the cultural gems of the neighborhood is the renowned Mana Contemporary Art Center. This awe-inspiring center is housed in a renovated old brick industrial building and offers exciting contemporary art exhibits and shows.

For those who love a little bit of greenery, the Hudson County Community College Park is a must-visit. This triangular communal space, adorned with railings and shrubs, provides jus
neighbourhood: Jersey City, New Jersey, United States

name: Rental unit in Jersey City · ★4.38 · 3 bedrooms · 4 beds · 1 bath
Condo in Jersey City · ★New · Studio · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Jersey City Heights is characterized as a traditional neighborhood community appealing to small-town values largely due to its ¾ mile main street, Central Avenue. The Central Avenue shopping district is home to more than 240 storefront businesses which primarily services the consumer market found in the Heights and neighboring communities.
Bordering the North end of the Heights is County-owned Washington Park. Pershing Field park is located in the center of this district offering green space, baseball fields, an Olympic size swimming pool, and an ice skating rink. Adjacent to Pershing Field Park in Reservoir#3 which constitutes one of the largest patches of green space in the Heights.
Two of the biggest landmarks in the Heights are Christ Hospital on Palisade Avenue and Leonard J. Gordan Park aka “mosquito park” on Kennedy Blvd. If you are familiar with this park’s historic art sculptures of Buffalo and Bears (c. 1907) then you probably get why the Heights is trademarked with
neighbourhood: Jersey City, New Jersey, United States

name: Rental unit in Jersey City · ★New · 7 bedrooms · 9 beds · 4 baths
neighborhood_overview: Known affectionately as the "sixth borough," Jersey City is staking its claim as a destination in its own right within the New York City metropolitan area. Young professionals, artists and families have flocked to the Jersey side of the Hudson in recent years and have created a city that is both an extension of Manhattan and a place where you can see and feel an authentic Jersey vibe. Visitors to New York City will find that Jersey City not only offers more reasonably-priced accommodations with easy access to the Big Apple, but also noteworthy parks, restaurants, bars and other attractions that will make for a fun and memorable trip.

neighborhood_overview: Known affectionately as the "sixth borough," Jersey City is staking its claim as a destination in its own right within the New York City metropolitan area. Young professionals, artists and families have flocked to the Jersey side of the Hudson in recent years and have created a city that is both an extension of Manhattan and a place where you can see and feel an authentic Jersey vibe. Visitors to New York City will find that Jersey City not only offers more reasonably-priced accommodations with easy access to the Big Apple, but also noteworthy parks, restaurants, bars and other attractions that will make for a fun and memorable trip.
host_about: Hello! I'm Danny and I've spent the last 30 years between Copake on the weekends and NYC in the Upper East Side so you can call me a true local in these parts of New York. My property manager CozySuites and I want to give you the best value and experience that we can. Occasionally you'll see me running around in Copake doing some handy work - I'm a carpenter by trade!

neighborhood_overview: While you may be tempted to spend all of your time exploring our gorgeous building, don't sleep on all of the offerings Jersey City has to offer! Rest and relax in this peaceful oasis perched on the edge of the river, which features plush mattresses, sophisticated wood furnishings, and spacious closets so you can unpack and stay for a while. After a day at the Metropolitan Museum of Art, a matinee show on Broadway, or a packed agenda of meetings, you’re bound to be hungry, Cook up a storm in the full kitchen, which features stainless steel appliances, including a full-size fridge and freezer, an electric stove, an oven, a microwave, and a dishwashe
host_about:
We have been providing vacation rental apartments for over 10 years across the East Coast. We are known for our distinctively furnished apartments in popular locations, and for our attentive service. You’ll find that our rates are quite reasonable. If you're looking for a safe, comfortable place with fabulous amenities and Wi-Fi (we know you need the Wi-Fi!) in the Boston MA area, Washington DC, Miami FL or very close to NYC in Jersey City or Hoboken, we'd love to host you. Many of the buildings where our apartments are located feature amenities such as beautiful lobbies, 24 hour front desk staff, fitness centers, business centers, recreation rooms, indoor or outdoor pools and whirlpools. If you are traveling with children, some buildings offer playgrounds (many buildings are near public playgrounds as well) or indoor playrooms. Depending on the location, you can stay for just a few days, a week, a month or more. 

We offer an assortment of short-term apartments in sizes ranging from a studio to three bedrooms that are fully furnished with all the comforts of home. Our local staff meticulously prepares your apartment before your arrival, and we offer 24 hour assistance for any emergencies after business hours. When you arrive at your apartment, the beds will be made, towels and bath amenities will be stocked in the bathrooms, and the coffee maker will be set up in the kitchen with some sample coffees, sweetener and creamer (teabags too if that is your preference) to start your morning off properly. If you’d like to cook a meal, the kitchen is stocked with dishes, cutlery, glassware and pots and pans. The living room is set up with a TV and cable channels, and the Wi-Fi router password and instructions will be prominently displayed so you can get connected quickly. You can also make local and toll-free phone calls at no charge. 

Please contact us to confirm the exact availability of the apartment you are interested in. We’d love to host you (and your family) for your vacation or business trip.

host_about:
NOT YOUR TRADITIONAL AIRBNB

 BP offers a unique boutique hotel-like experience. Tap into this delight of carefully selected minimalist interiors with intelligent design properties and be astonished by our highly rated Five-Star hospitality services.

All luxurious apartments are designed and dedicated exclusively to selected Airbnb guests. 

Each location is professionally serviced daily. A thoroughly trained cleaning staff will visit each property daily, following a strict and rigorous cleaning protocol.  

This authentic approach starts with our 24-hour concierge service ensuring all your needs are met while maximizing your experience before, during, and after your stay.

Welcome to BETTI PROPERTY MANAGEMENT.

There is a bar, Oleary's, on Garfield Avenue & Claremont Avenue, that serves good food.

There is also the Light Rail Cafe just past the Garfield Avenue Light Rail on Randolph Avenue.

name: Rental unit in Jersey City · ★New · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
The apartment is located in the vibrant neighborhood of Journal Square in Jersey City, New Jersey. Known for its diverse community and lively atmosphere, Journal Square is a popular destination for both residents and visitors alike.

The area is a hub for transportation, with the Journal Square Transportation Center just a few blocks away. This makes it easy to access other parts of Jersey City, as well as Manhattan and other parts of New York City. There are also several bus stops and a PATH train station nearby.

In terms of entertainment and dining options, Journal Square has something for everyone. There are numerous restaurants serving a variety of cuisines, from Italian to Indian to Mexican. You'll also find plenty of cafes and bars, as well as a movie theater and a bowling alley.

For outdoor enthusiasts, there are several parks and green spaces in the area, including the large and beautiful Lincoln Park, which features sports fields, tennis courts,
